BYPWxA-ngfyUG1g5pCFTAg.text: Oh boy what a satisfying chunk of fried fish.I ordered a small cod fish with fries and a small chocolate ice cream. The fish was fantastic, great texture, good crispy coating, and flakey fish inside. The small size along with fries was enough to satisfy, though I wanted more. The fries were quite forgettable. I only chose to eat them with a good serving of ketchup. The ice cream was very small and nothing special as well. Overall, the fish was great and the other items were just okay. I would come back and recommend this place for its superb fish.

ojtQ3I9NQ4C9NuGT0v2FcQ.text: Stumbled upon this place and really enjoyed the cod and chips. The portion was huge! I ended up sharing the plate with my girlfriend. Tartar sauce was excellent as well.

hyGq_-Y1aR2CfZH5GlhlWw.text: Golden Union is nestled in a narrow alleyway  near Oxford St. They are infamous for their fish n' chips (obvi). I tried both their Cod and Haddock fish n' chips. I really enjoyed both. Make sure to order the small size plates (unless you have been starved for days or you are a multi food eating contest champion)! Because the portions here are HUGE! I could barely finish the small plate! Also, get the Tartare sauce, you won't regret it! Overall, very cool atmosphere and friendly staff, they've even got a retro jukebox that plays some awesome music.

YepPK7Ge5ysuHya2WgAfBw.text: Well, I haven't tried them all, but I have tried enough to know that Golden Union deserves the title of 'best fish & chips in London.'  Nothing fancy, just quality fish & chips.  The venue is small and does not accept reservations.  The service was outstanding. The food was amazing.  No need for a large portion, the small/regular is almost impossible to finish.  Enjoyed our visit here.  Would visit again!

5Cg-wi8tk3f72zY8P-oBbw.text: Haddock, chips, mushy peas, tartare sauce and a pint of London Pride.That right there is the holy, um, trinity of five components that make up my perfect meal at Golden Union. Easily the best 'traditional' fish n chips place around Soho, The batter is perfect, the chips are finely balanced between crispy and mushy, the peas and tartare sauce are made fresh onsite and the beer, is, well, beer (if you're having trouble with that last part give me a shout; I'll gladly show you the ropes). Even better, the name isn't some kind of fish pun.Most of the fish dishes here are good. They offer all the usual trappings along with some specials depending on the season. The highlight for me is the haddock, but the rock salmon is also quite tasty. Don't like fish? What's wrong with you!? That's OK though; they also make pies which are again homemade rather than that not-particularly-pukka stuff which are, again, decent.The surroundings are actually quite nice if you don't mind tiles everywhere, and the staff are friendly.Honestly you can't go wrong if you're in the area and fancy fish and chips. And beer.

V8Ndm1q8V_Iu3Rm15MsKWA.text: Delicious flaky fried goodness. Sadly they ran out of haddock while we were there, but the cod was still pretty darn good. The chips were equally delightful, and the small was plenty large enough for one person. If you're looking for fish and chips, Golden Union Fish Bar is definitely worth a visit!

pDc6ao-ZzMkcLBd1ve8AdQ.text: Went to Golden Fish Bar based on Yelp reviews.  This is an authentic fish and chips place.  Many locals were eating here as well as tourist.  Menu is simple 4 kinds of deep fried fish and chips.  Get some mushy peas to complete the classic meal.  Wife and I each had the cod and haddock, all good.

X-YpF7g_eeO-guCStf3ecw.text: I went for the normal size. The piece of cod was fairly small but good and succulent with light, crisp batter. Chips were OK, a bit boring. Not a huge portion size but adequate.  Mushy peas had been seasoned with a large amount of black pepper and strange colour which was a different take on this side dish.Overall OK but didn't wow me. Valuewise, it was OK but totaled £13.50 with a cup of tea so a little steep.

bWP5y6lQzNQagvFqjpFfAw.text: Excellent chip shop!  Traveled extensively in England and found this to be towards, if not, the top spot to date.

HRu9xzW2zDP-5mGmhas8-w.text: This was our first fish and chips stop. It set the bar so high, nothing else we had compared. The cod, oh my, I wish I lived in London!

zp3eRcQsm_xX8WLXEUe34g.text: Qualität - gut. Aber... Die Preise sind sündhaft teuer. Ich fühle mich wie in einer Touristenfalle. The Dining Plaice (drei Gehminuten entfernt) ist viel besser!

aqjKw8rpkkICLROgfTkTtw.text: Mmmm...I've sought out and eaten fish and chips from Bondi Beach Australia, Nantucket to Soho. Golden Union is one of the coolest F&C shops in the world. The mushy peas are quintessential British fare and tarter sauce divine.   The chips are crazy good, The fish breading is lovely. The shop is located in a really cool area of SOHO, an easy cab ride from most anywhere. If you're scoping out Fish and Chips, this is a good bet.

JuqN_pPrcW4O6LSL7x82-w.text: My second 5* review in one day.  Crazy crazy.There's no way that fish and chips can get better than this.  Beautifully juicy, fresh fish with super light and tasty batter.  Had the cod.  Very nice chips, far more than any one person could eat IMO.  Tangy Tartar sauce actually made on the premises and mushy peas that were quite delish.  Waitress was super friendly and tariff was very acceptable for London.  By far my best fish and chips experience out of three on my week long trip.  Just go to Golden Union!

ZSNEHxwohFteEO_r7PHCCg.text: Best fish, chips and mushy peas I had in the UK. Nothing out of the ordinary, just good quality fish, well cooked chips, and the best mushy peas I have ever had. That's the thing about mushy peas, they're meant to be stodgy, and their mushy peas are stodginess central. But they taste great - and work really well with the fish and the chips. Make sure you order a small, unless you are looking at completing your week's caloric intake in the one sitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Best
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Best
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Fish,chips and mushy peas.

LDCvZ30nWbciZUN-3erb-g.text: Had a friend from the US visiting, and of course, she wanted to try All Things British... what better thing to try than fish and chips! I'm not a fish and chips regular, so had to do a bit of yelp-searching to find this place, and like the reviews said, it's a great find. We both had the haddock and chips (doused in salt and vinegar, of course), along with homemade tartar sauce... delish. And in such a convenient area too! If I ever have a hankering for some fish and chips again, I'll be sure to visit again and hopefully will try a milkshake to top it off.

vx30nE9n1S02VQlcimvIOg.text: Definitely the place to go for Fish and Chips if you're in the Soho area. I really do like this place. Have come here twice now. If you're in the Covent Garden area, I would suggest sticking around Endell St for Rock and Sole Plaice, as I really wouldn't come here all the way from CG if you're already there. Vice versa of course. The fish here is very very smooth. Have had both the cod and haddock and equally brilliant. The flesh flakes off even without the help of a fish knife, and the batter remains crispy despite my heavy handed vinegar habits. Didn't get to try the tartare sauce, since £2 does make it a bit pricey for sauce. Anyway, the chips were great, the fish was great, the ambience is great. Service was pretty dang good, and most certainly cheaper than R&SP (as Michael's already reviewed)... I'd definitely come back for sure.

ElSMpOkMpxdYG9mjUqq30g.text: Exhausted after a day of Oxford shopping we were looking forward to a traditional fish and chip meal. We were greeted by an impatient hostess who thought it would a good idea to place a baby carriage in the middle of an entry way. While asking her to please find us an alternate seat. I glanced at my daughter and husband and noticed both were gagging near vomiting. The oil smelt as if it hadn't been replaced in weeks. Terrible smelling place. Terrible rude wait staff. In a word terrible. You'd be better off with a McDonalds burger.

gzGYA2hxxbjWq9I2sLXHDg.text: Outstanding fish and chips! Light, crispy, battered perfection. We ordered 1 large cod and 1 large pollack. Both great, but a slight tip of the hat to the cod due to the firmer texture. What you've read is true: the homemade tartar is an absolute must - it's delicious and the best we had on our entire trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Interior. Cozy with very friendly staff.
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Ketchup.
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large cod and large pollack. Delicious!

UgiffbCM3hsohetgSRB9Iw.text: first time ever having fish and chips and first restaurant we tried in london. I guess the fish was suppose to be rather bland and needs tartar sauce and the salt and pepper on the table? (i'm clearly a noob) we didn't order tartar sauce, so that was probably my first mistake. we ordered one large plate of the haddock and shared, probably my second mistake for not trying something else... i drowned my chips in the ketchup, cause that's just how i enjoy my "fries" but the ketchup tasted funny, third mistake. we tried fish and chips again elsewhere, i thought it was a much better experience.

xqYE6sfiIngKoIxaT8yygg.text: Very yummy fish & chips.The portions are very generous and the service is nice.I wished they had mushy peas, they ran out at that moment.

TuHzgeNH-zcq1wJk0yIDrw.text: When you visit London, you have to try Fish and Chips, I mean they're well known for that. We were on Oxford Street for their nighttime shopping, and we came across this place. We looked at some yelp reviews and decided to give it a try. You can either order to go or dine in, but tables are limited since the store is kind of small. I ordered the salmon and chips and my husband order the regulars fish and chips. It came out pretty quick and oh boy, it was so crispy and meat tasted perfectly. The portion is huge so recommend to share with someone else and order other items on the menu to try.

U3CZWK2esyOMjBUrEILvtA.text: This place was pretty good, first time having fish and chips, figured I had to have it as its a known thing in London. One bad thing, one of my prawns had poop in it, it was not cleaned, I did not complain but just had to stop eating and knew I wouldn't return. My coworkers loved the fish and chips tho, so I felt I couldn't give them a bad review after all. The ambience is really casual and there is waitress service

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Prawn and Chips

FJm76Q97_r_EAGGoIzwE8Q.text: Ate here at around 3pm and noticed a good amount of people having a late lunch like us. Boyfriend and I didn't want to spoil our appetites for dinner so we opted to share a small plate of fish and chips between us. The plate was actually quite large and we were both satisfied with our portions despite sharing. The batter on the fish was delicious and crispy, and the cod itself was tender and fresh. I loved fried things and the batter was almost perfect. The fries (chips!) were okay, not bad but not great either. There's definitely room for improvement on those. I like that they don't salt them so you can put however much salt you desire.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Small plate of the cod fish & chips split between us.

UNssPrXsuuf3UdtzT96XuA.text: Amazing Fish and Chips!  I didn't believe other reviews suggesting to split the large, but you can definitely split the large fish and chips.  My wife had the cod and I had the haddock and you really can't go wrong either way.  The haddock was more flaky and the cod was a little meatier but both were 5/5.  Chips were great too.

gvR7otmeKo607WsRFp8FBQ.text: If you're not from London this is a great place to grab authentic fish and chips. I was visiting with two girls I was studying abroad with and we loved this place! They have great food that's a decent price for London. I had fish and chips multiple times while in London but this place was by far the best! They have a large selection of fish. I had the cod and it was fabulous. If you can't decide between a large or small plate, the large plate is huge! If you're a small person like me you can definitely get by with the smaller plate option.The service was great! A really great environment that has a diner feel to it! They also have a take out option if you're too tired from exploring. Definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Small cod plate

NUKKEEGXP8I70nCJd48I-A.text: First meal after arriving in London in September 2016 and our first dish was the British specialty, fish and chips! Location: Golden Union has a very convenient location, just on an alley off Oxford Street. we arrived around 2pm on a Saturday, and luckily there were no line up and we were seated immediately.Food: We ordered the Cod & chips and homemade pie & chips with gravy. The fish were excellent as it was golden crispy outside, while the inside was soft. Chips were good too, made with good quality British potato. The pie was not as amazing, and we found it on the salty side.Price: the Cod & chips was 12.50 for small, and the homemade pie & chips with gravy was 9.95. This is typical price in London, but considering that it is close to Oxford Street and has higher quality fish and chips than other touristy restaurants, Golden Union has good value.Recommendation: We give it 4 stars, and would definitely recommend to anyone seeking good fish and chips in the heart of London!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

DKnlJR9RAeZtRwUwBoyIqA.text: Literally the best fish and chips I've ever eaten in the whole world. Highly recommend the haddock and chips (small or large size-- large is HUGE). The tartar sauce is amazing but they only give you a little bit with your fish and chips. If you order extra sauce, it's almost 2 pounds for it but the container of sauce is bigger. The haddock is thick and flaky, excellent flavor, excellent batter. Thick steak-cut french fries also great. There is a selection of beer/cider/wine.

cBIZd5x8DugfjariUbk45Q.text: Definitely not worth the hype simply because of how the matter reacts with the fish. I got the large cod. Taste okay but not crispy and the batter just got mushy. The mushy peas were okay on taste, off on texture. The chips were okay, the tarter sauce was good.

NZC-ryF3rL4W51s-LzoyCA.text: This fish and chips place is definitely the best one I have ever been into. Food is just deliciously prepared and people working there are the nicest ever. Not to mention the amount of food you get! Love this place with my whole heart and always coming back for more when in London!

lPTW-Z8qNRbvHoGhrgedrA.text: Visited here in March, and I still think about the fish and chips I had here at times. I had given up on fish and chips a while ago as all the places I've tried in SoCal were very underwhelming, till I tried fish and chips from here. Tartar sauce was very impressive, full of flavors and fresh ingredients and absolutely the best tartar sauce I've ever tried. Fish itself was superb as well. Would definitely go back if I ever visit London again

OZpQu0fjBtMErHwla2gnuQ.text: My first time in the U.K. (~5ish years ago), I was mostly unimpressed by the fish & chips served at an unknown pub and left thinking fish & chips pretty much tasted the same, anywhere. During this trip (Nov. 2016), I made slightly more effort to find better fish & chips and ended up here: it was worth it.The fish-fry here is much lighter and crispier than I've had elsewhere, due to a thinner, tempura-like crust. I liked this a lot because you could actually enjoy the taste of the fish instead of being literally weighed down by unnecessarily thick batter. The chips took a back-seat here: they are like "steak fries" in the U.S., except somehow less satisfying. (sorry U.K., but we Americans are awfully good at frying fries) Still, the chips make up half the dish of "fish & chips" so you'll end up eating them anyway. Stick to the fried fish here and you will be rewarded.On our way out, I was taking one last glance at the menu on the wall when the cook (and possibly owner) asked if everything was okay. (Yes. It was.) He then proceeded to tell me with pride that the difference between Golden Union's fish & chips and everywhere else in the city is that the fish is frozen elsewhere while Golden Union uses fish that arrives the same morning, often with the blood still dripping off it. I left thinking that I was impressed by how much he cares about his fried fish, which he fried perfectly every time. Finally, I leave my heart to the homemade tartar sauce, a sauce that I often hate but not here.

hSIXULI24aqS_4Mu-Q3a8A.text: The Golden Union Fish Bar was excellent.A little cramped but worth the stay.The cod was VERY fresh and VERY hot when it came out and the chips were equally excellent.The bathroom was only for one, so that was a bit of a wait.I would return.

xKKiNlmQ5ZMd3tEkX3EP-Q.text: SERVICE:Service here is good. The waitress was friendly and tentative (granted I was the first and only person in the restaurant at 11:30 sharp). FOOD:I ordered the fish and chips. You can either chose Cod or Haddock, but I chose Cod since I had the Haddock before elsewhere. Cod is chunkier and has a less fishy taste to it, and to be honest it's a bit bland for my pallet, but some people prefer it over Haddock. The crispiness of the deep fried batter was great but the chips/fries were a bit less crispy and more on the mushy side. It does not come with tartar sauce and I believe it costs extra, though you do have vinegar and ketchup for free. It wasn't the best I had but still good. COST:If you plan on taking out, the price is dramatically cheaper. If my memory serves me correctly, a small portion of fish and chips would cost about 6 GBP if you chose take out, but then almost double to about 12 GBP if you chose to dine in. I chose to dine in which amounted my bill to 13.14 GBP after the service charge. No drink was ordered.If I ever come back, I think I will try the Haddock fish and chips next time with tartar sauce. I wouldn't mind giving this place a second go!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Small plate of cod fish and chips. If you dine-in the total comes out to 13.14 (or about $21.80 USD)

FvqH0HKPFsMr1rMrd8wVtg.text: Outstanding fish and chips. Wide variety of fish to choose from. Cod and halibut are the most popular, but there are several others. You can order to take away or for a few pounds more you can find your own seat. Service is friendly.Word of advice to the uninitiated or the uninformed (and those who are both, but maybe forgot this): Take your time when the meal arrives. It looks as delicious as it is - lightly breaded and crispy steaming. You will want to dig in immediately. Wait. Otherwise you will sear yourself and not be able to taste and enjoy the rest of the meal.Try the mushy peas. It's traditional.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. classic

t2fNr_fh1iJrOS9NNOtbWw.text: Ranked as one of the best fish and chips place in London, I had to eat here! Came when it opened at 11:30 and was seated right away.  You can order take away in the front but make sure to walk to the back if you wanna dine in the restaurant. The service was fast and the portions are HUGE so make sure you order the smaller portion of the fish.  The fish was fresh and flaky and the chips were delicious.  I ordered the fried prawns and they were actually tastier than my husband's fried cod! Make sure to order a side of tarter sauce and mashed peas to complete your English experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

H16aOQwjcJUTHl-d4OKDxw.text: Came here for some authentic F&C during an extended layover at Heathow.  We took the tube into the city to see some sights, and came here for lunch.  Fish was great, flaky, like I remembered when I used to live in London when I was in college.   Good value for the price in my opinion - for downtown London anyways.  What I really liked was the ketchup squeezer - really cute plastic tomato.  It is a quick in and out sort of place - good for lunches and quick eats while walking around downtown.    You make your order at the counter, go sit down and the food comes out to you.   Really good spot, A for effort.

nlGpscZ5GOOAipdHExToQg.text: First time in London, gotta have fish 'n chips. My friend found this place and said that it's a local favorite, so we came here. It was quite a walk from Buckingham Palace, where we were dropped off, but we enjoyed the stroll.We both ordered the cod and chips (or was it haddock and chips, either way, it was 11.95 pounds for the small). There was a LOT of fish and even more fries. You have to order the tartar sauce separately. It would've been wiser if we ordered one large tartar sauce to share instead of two individuals, but I must've gotten confused when the waitress asked me the question. I also ordered a bottle of Lipton's lemon iced tea, which was delicious. Service was good, although we had to ask for our check. Environment was great. We got seated immediately. The restroom is in the back corner of the room, not really separate from the room, so try not to sit anywhere near the restroom. Also, the restroom is only one room, not a restroom with multiple stalls, so there might be a wait. You can't really tell if the restroom is being occupied because there's no vacant/occupied sign depending on if the door is locked or not, so it might get awkward. Double check that you've locked the door if you're paranoid like me.The only reason I give four stars is because I felt like my health went down as and after I ate the fish 'n chips here. I wish there was something like spinach. I had to get a Green Goodness from Pret A Manger afterwards to cleanse.

6WhvgS6d3aXBn1XFTllt0g.text: 3.5 stars. Not bad for a quick split meal. The portions are huge and we didn't even order the large portion. It's exactly what you expect, fish and chips. The fish is flakey and moist with a Crispy batter... The chips are a bit soggy for me. I must also say they are also a little bland but that's what the ketchup and tartar sauce is for.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

y-5JKCLXA9Y2_lZROgl6Sw.text: I came here for their fish and chips. Even the small (6-8 oz) cod and chips is huge. The fish is very fresh and tender inside. The coating is ordinary, but their tartar sauce is awesome and it's one of the best I've had. It goes really well with the coating. The fries are ordinary. I guess I like smaller fries than bigger chunks. Their ketchup container is super cute. The service is good and every staff is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips (small) 6-8 oz

6n3wi-uNEFx6iemGSETBGw.text: Super convenient location...right off of Oxford street. The portions are huge and shareable. My boyfriend and I shared a small cod and fish which worked for us. There was a long wait in the beginning but after a long day of shopping it was well worth it. If you're looking for a place to satisfy your fish & chips craving..this would be it!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cod & Chips :)

dT4lp9SA5YrK3trGUxxY7Q.text: This place, found on Yelp is a major Fish n Chips restaurant in Soho. Do not expect here a charming or comfortable place. They focused on the quality and quantity, with a large choice of fish, and a yummy home made tartare sauce.People are going there all day long, and there is a queue at lunch and dinner time. So please be patient. 7pm on a Sunday= 1 hour from when we arrived to when we left.

Ft1N2S6aLqrcvStqHQlEhQ.text: This was the first fish and chips we had at London.  So honestly, I don't know the standard of a great tasting fish and chips here... but this is my personal opinion on the food. The chips were decent, looked and tasted fresh.  I hear UK doesn't make it as crispy as USA.  The batter of the fish was crispy, not so oily, and goodThe fish was one huge portion of the fish, battered up (we got the large Cod and shared).  It looked pretty fresh.The portions are pretty big and plus we had eaten 2 hours ago, so it was more than enough for us to share. And the tartar sauce was deliciousSo everything (ingredient-wise) was pretty decent, yet I wouldn't come here.  It wasn't great when you put them all together.  Like, you know those girls who have a reaaaally pretty eyes, nose, and mouth... yet did not have a pretty face?  It was like that... I can't pinpoint what I didn't like about it... but it just wasn't good.If you sit in and eat, they charge you about 3 or 4 pounds extra and include a "optional" gratuity, fixed into your bill.

r2JcS6hBWMQFFgZXKJ_hAw.text: Sooo good. I learned the difference between a place that sells fish and chips and a fish a chips shop. This is a fish and chips shop. Quick. Tasty. Atmospheric.

kRUQKCYirgy1cy3C8FJa5w.text: I ordered the fish and chips (cod) and maloumi (fried cheese).   I liked the fish, but the chips were ok.   Service was good and pricing was also fair as well.  Would recommend this place to anyone who is in the area.

OK6zy9wSvC8vW9i8dkolXg.text: Me and my friend came to London for a few days and wanted to find some fish and chips, so I looked on yelp saw the good reviews and decided to come here for dinner. The restaurant has take away and dine in. The take away is slightly cheaper and everything is sold individually. The restaurant has a American diner feel to it and they have a free juke box.  I ordered the large cod and my friend ordered the large haddock. The large order is one large piece of fish and the chips is enough to share for two. The batter is very light and airy which is different than most. The fish was very soft and melted in my mouth. I tried the haddock and the cod and I liked the cod slightly more. I thought the cod was softer. The chips were thick and were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Overall I would definitely suggest this fish and chips place when in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Outside sign
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large order of haddock and chips
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large order of cod and chips

LNgzVxT2zPayxedhD_Um8A.text: We had fish and chips (all of us) , we either had the cod or the haddock. Both were delicious. The fish was freshly fried and not too heavy. The place is Basic but we did have table service. A great find and not crowded . I would go here again when in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Small order cod and chips

dwdw0Pm22HeJU9SNZUXFig.text: This is by far my favourite fish and chips restaurant in London. The fish is well cooked in clean cooking oils, in a way that is not "heavy" at all - having a really easy irritated stomach :) in oily food, this shop has the easiest to digest fish and chips. It is absolutely delicious; either you order the classic dish or just fish bites. You can take away or just sit in the small cosy area at the end.

QY13Eqx1t7zAznnawnpLYw.text: Quite the touristy day for us: spent (almost) all day watching HP & the CC, came here for a quick bite during the break.  It was a great choice, the fish was golden and crispy, incredibly light and flavorful.  The chips were excellent.  My only complaint was that the mushy peas were quite under seasoned, but once an adequate amount of salt was added, they were an excellent accompaniment to the fish!  I guess another complaint is that I left feeling uncomfortably stuffed (and I didn't even finish my "small" serving!) but that is 100% on me.The ambience is quite nice as well: nothing fancy, but updated and welcoming.

0nLNIlkks7JMpWOQJROwIA.text: We have fish and chips every day that we are in the U.K. and this is one of the best places we have visited. Four years ago my Airbnb host recommended this place and I had the best Fish and Chips of that trip. This trip,  I just couldn't remember the name of this place. So, I googled "best fish & chips" and settled on a place between Piccadilly Circus and the British Museum.  It was my luck that I picked the same place I visited so long ago.The haddock was nice and flaky and the cod was good too. My daughter said she didn't like the batter on her prawn and chips. The service was friendly. I appreciated that they give you tap water when you ask for water. I was so tired of paying for bottled water all over Europe. The take away price is much cheaper than dining in. We dined in. If I hadn't been on the verge of hanger, I would have done take away. Since we have had Fish & Chips in lots of places, we recommend that you avoid the Fish & Chips served at Tower of London (unless you are absolutely starving), you can find better options outside the tower walls.

XurbfdqRy54GW7zfdHhiQw.text: Really good fish and chips! The fish was moist, flaky, delicate and the exterior was crispy, not overly battered, and not too oily. The homemade tartar sauce was delicious and the chips were also cooked well. Never thought fish and chips could be special, but glad I was able to try the authentic dish in London.

ZGCq-Jyz5lryzQ2eGV7Baw.text: Loved the fish and chips here!  Fish was huge, and outstanding flavor.  I am not normally a fan of tartar sauce, but theirs I couldn't get enough of.  I will come back here next time I am in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Very busy even late at night
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large cod. Excellent

VAMLDKz2NFdTBJwlvuvR_A.text: Golden Union was okay, but I had better fish and chips for less elsewhere in the city.I came in for a later dinner around 7 or 8.  The place was fairly busy, but as I was a single customer I was quickly seated.  They informed me that the large fish was out, which was completely okay because the small was more food than most people can or should eat.  It is huge.  I ordered a small and a honeycomb shake and patiently waited.The food came out pretty quickly and was nice and hot.  The fish was good, but not as good as some of the other places I visited.  The same can be said about the fries, they were just a little too mushy for me.  The shake was the highlight of the meal, which is a little disappointing at a fish and chips place in London.Overall it was an okay meal, but the price was too much for what I got in comparison with the quality and price of similar places.  Nothing here was particularly bad, it was just more expensive than better food had at other places.It's also worth noting that all my London meals were paid for by work and I still found this one overpriced.

NoAdVzHgfxRky2NJRaLerg.text: Me and my man were shopping at Oxford Street when we decided to look for a lunch place with fish and chips. We had never tried the authentic thing before since we live in Sweden. So we randomly chose a little side street to try and look for something in the good old way - and there it was. It looked so simple from the outside but when we went in it felt like entering a whole new world containing fish, chips and delicious dip. We came right before the lunch rush so we got the last table before the line suddenly was all around the corner! The manager seated us, handed us the menus and we got our food very fast. Both of us had the cod and God all mighty was that GOOD! The batter was fried perfectly crispy and the fish inside was so soft - not an ounce of chewiness - and together with the lovely chips it was one of our best meals this far in England. A must to visit for the real deal! I really recommend this place for both tourists and English people (there seemed to be a LOT of locals there as well).

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. The regular lovely cod with chips! Super fun and quirky interior was a big plus!

KotCHFcETMPg4_ohRnM6zg.text: Let me just start by saying that I don't like fish nor do I like fried fish. I went here with my mom and dad because he loves fish. I don't so I looked for something else in the menu. I got the fried sausage and my mom got the fried cheese. We were both satisfied and amazed about how good they both were. Go here

C3r5f6sFLA4RibHF4Fu7JA.text: Being in London, I knew I wanted to get fish and chips. The golden union did not disappoint. I ordered the large cod and chips, but probably would have been okay with the small. The large would be good for someone really hungry or to share with two people. It came with homemade tartar sauce which was amazing! We debated ordering extra but I was able to steal my moms instead. The batter was also light and very good. Exactly the way fish and chips is supposed to be. We went around 16:00 and the place was already 3/4 full. So if you go later, I wouldn't be surprised if there was a wait. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

HrOsNvkr-tfMa6WShR6_6g.text: Highly recommended.  2nd best out of 3 locations we tried.  Have had Fish & Chips around EU for over a couple of decades now and this is probably one of the best in the city I've had.  Simple, fast, and economically priced right in the heart of the city so easy-peezy to get to and all.

xCLne6uAEv-YA_kROnxkwQ.text: Fish was not edible and the chips were awful. Only thing I'd get again here was the milkshake - best milkshake in the UK! We should have turned around as soon as we got a whiff of the horrible stench as we walked in. Not sure what these other good reviews are about.

xCJ_Jp6CGBnBt2bBaemm8Q.text: I was hoping to have A five-star experience like many others that have reviewed this restaurant unfortunately I did not. Because the messages was great staff was very friendly, the set up was cool, and in a great Location. Couple minutes walk from the underground. The reason why I am giving two stars is because the fish had no flavor and the chips were just ok. Being that I haven't had fish and chips for years and I was in London from a long layover I had high hopes to get some good fish and chips but sadly I didn't.

Op-tQ9Z4AF43DN2IB7am6w.text: Delicious fish & chips !!! The piece of Haddock was massive and was made fresh to order.  Restaurant is located in the cool SoHo neighborhood.  Love the neon sign outside as well as the decor inside.  Staff were very friendly and helpful and the chips did a nice job of lining my belly before a couple beers !

D1dSIB8nVHdEXkrGZewYAg.text: Every time I crave fish and chips (fries for the Americans), I really want them, but then I eat them and wonder why I craved it in the first place. The batter is inevitably too thick and oily, the fish is inevitably bland. I will say that Golden Union's fish tasted really fresh, and of the fish and chips I've tried throughout London, their execution is pretty good. Super friendly and nice table service!

_C7l43IoZwt-qK34Rdp-Pg.text: This Fish Bar was really good. I have to say, I haven't had fish & chips or mushy peas before, but I very much enjoyed my experience here. The portions were quite large, even for the standard size meal. The fish seemed to be good quality and there was not too much breading. The staff was alos very friendly. This is in a great location in the heart of lots of bars, restaurants, and shopping. I would definitely recommend a friend checking them out!

MtBrLHyWeNxu03zoJ0fEPg.text: The servings were huge and they were very generous with the chips. The haddock and cod was huge too and well served. We had the mushy peas as sides and that was good too. Service was good and efficient.

yH4gGXJDMk0Af6pHPEc6Vw.text: First the good - fish is great quality and possibly worth putting up with the rest of the place.The not so good - the service was really, really slow and not that great. Very cramped seating, I'm small and thin and could barely fit into the inside seat. They were out of about half the items on the menu.  There are about 6 beers on menu, all bottles, and they were out of 3 of them.  There's nothing like being in the land of beer and sipping on a corona, which of course they had plenty of. That is, nothing good about it. Big sign on the wall about their milkshakes, ordered two for the kids but they were  out of those too, every flavor. Also only one toilet in the whole place, constant line and bunch of people standing around the door.  Oh yeah, it would not flush either so it wasn't pretty.I probably won't go back but i wouldnt necessarily steer people away, the food quality was good.

v91cGOevbeFugwvwpGhz1w.text: Bloody delicious. The best fish and chips I've ever had. Service is a bit slow but it's worth it.

TAeR612SvUuATDoewGMZ4g.text: This place came as a recommendation.  I've been 3 times now over the past several months and I seem to make in an early stop each time I'm in London.  The atmosphere is blah, the floor is greasy/slippery, but the fish and chips are very good indeed.  I have always had a pleasant experience and the staff do their best to keep tables turning over as quickly as possible.  The haddock seems to sell out each time I'm there, but the last time I was able to get it and now I know why ... it was great.  I love the unique tartar sauce.  I'll be going back for sure.

FHUeb78b7hWc2-i6dH-saQ.text: We had the cod and chips and the battered halloumi with chips. Neither of us finished the dishes, it didn't taste that much, lack of flavors, also looks very boring on the plate. I truly believe this kind of dishes can be made much better elsewhere.

goJh9rpBgfl98l-E2vUkPg.text: Proper and legit fish and chips shop and it has a waiter service for sit downs!Get the cod or haddock and chips. The small was quite large (I could not finish). The fish were battered perfectly, and the fish was moist and had a perfect texture. They also have a variety of sides, including mushy peas, gravy, etc. Good selection of beer as well.

ueizpnTPzHLJJs1leCayuQ.text: Wanted a good fish n'chips while in London. Was pleased to find this fairly nearby to the hotel. The fish is fresh and light and crispy. The chips are great. Poland Street is flanked with a few Pubs as well. Ordered the large cod and chips it was a full piece of fish. The wife had the small cod and chips and it was a generous piece of fish. Saw the Prawns and got a side order as well with some chili sauce. The Tarter sauce is am extra charge but well worth the money. They make the tarter sauce in-house...not like anything in the USA!Would definitely recommend Golden Union Fish n'Chips1

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large Cod N' Chips and some King Prawns

c1YBdZD6Ci-6efximwWZxw.text: What a great fish & chip joint! The tartar sauce was exquisite for the fish. We liked the cod better than the haddock because it tasted more tender. The waitress was also super friendly and attentive. And they are even equipped with a kiddie menu and crayons. Never would've thought of it from the outside. We will probably go back again at some point during our visit.

s11ib3sTjqcmCp88khsibg.text: Loved this little place. Saw it had great reviews and decided to give it a try. It was well worth the long walk from Harrods. The cod and chips were wonderful paired with a Fullers. Fish was hot, crispy and tender inside. Service was friendly and attentive. In a neat and enjoyable part of London as well. Highly recommend!

6FWnhIhqLJS2QPzBfo3HTg.text: Absolutely delightful! Just what I wanted, an honest to goodness Fish and Chips. The small cod was just the right amount. Batter was very light and the fish very tender.  Even the French rose was great. Waitress was very good. A very nice experience - highly recommended.

I6-OWFC7-tEqq5NfClIFuw.text: While in London, you must get fish and chips, right?I was directed to Golden Union Fish Bar from all the reviews on Yelp, and I was not disappointed.  I ordered the 'small' plate of cod and chips.  The fish was huge.  Definitely not what I would consider small.  I like my fish to be chunkier, so this was the right choice for me.  Not too greasy and nice and meaty.  The chips I wasn't too thrilled about.  I like my fries to be small and crispy, and these were thick and soft.My husband ordered the large haddock and chips.  His fish was flaky as opposed to my chunky.  Both were different in texture, but both were very delicious.  And get the homemade tartare sauce.  So so good!

NE-Z0OOZJWIS0Eyl8ydJEQ.text: We googled best Fish & Chips in London, and were not disappointed.  The large is huge, and I'm a big boy.  Couldn't finish it.  We had traditional Cod & Chips, but the other menu items looked just as good.  You'd think fried fish and chips are going to be  about the same anywhere, but they have it down to a science.  I wanted to go back and eat it again for super.  Outstanding!  I ate Fish & Chips in Ireland as well (more than once in each country), and this was by far the best!

gIEFYhfiBzXJ5NCgCn1bWA.text: ordered:LARGE COD with CHIPS: so good! The cod was huge! the fries were perfectly crisp.. you must order the homemade tartar sauce to go with.The servers were so nice! Will definitely be back when I come back to London.

UN664B0ITRJD06h2emoY5g.text: Had the cod and haddock. And a stout and a San Pelligrini. Lovely food. Friendly service.

DlqwmI457jgdEObN1j21ng.text: All I can say is WOW! Definitely some of the best Fish & Chips I have ever had. Huge portions and they serve beer. Service is fast and the staff are very friendly, especially considering the turnover they must have. Remember this is a Fish & Chip bar, so the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, but it's worth it for the food.

U7AiQeOqtO1dbtSoWT1qjA.text: Fish and chips is quite the simple meal but there are many things that can go wrong while preparing a portion. For example, the oil that is used to fry the fish is important because it transfers that certain aftertaste on it. One can choose between a whole fired fish and smaller chunks of delicious heaven, wrapped in deliciousness. As you can imagine, I prefer my chips to be accompanied by pieces of fish, deeply fried and served hot. So the plan should be like this - go to Golden Union, order any fish with chips, garnish with the homemade mushy peas and just go to heaven. It's as simple as that.

yL0JZIry1sHp2GcGmhiXIA.text: Fries were not fresh, they were served cold too, the fish were fine.Service was slow and poor..The meal was too expensive for its worthWhen u get in there is a very strong smell of fried food, much than u expect. It got stuck to my clothes.I definitely do NOT recommend

66H1uXd3ztH4l5dHbXxcUQ.text: This is some of the best fish and chips I have had in London. At first I thought it was going to be a food chain type of place, but it was the complete opposite. The food and staff are great and the prices are reasonable.

S3cFcnqMKGP7eAyFV_6WQA.text: LOVE IT!!!!! Simply good! Big portion~ can share if u have two girls~~

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Regular Cod~ Large size that already split in half~ Good enough for me~

GQZJAu2k3-BgTC0Jv79VqA.text: I good fish and  hips place.  The large other gives you a massive pice of cod.  I did find the fish a little too greasy, but that's life..I went in the middle of the day and it was busy which is a good sign.

PiHhauPU5ri3Iq67GEOPkg.text: Not sure what the hype is about here.  We walked awhile to find this spot in hopes of some wonderful fish and chips but were very disappointed.  The fish was certainly fresh but the batter did not stay on the fish at all.  The chips were mediocre at best.  As we were looking to satisfy a craving this did not do the trick.  I appreciate the options of fish but would prefer a traditional 1 fish menu if the overall meal was better.  The best part of this meal was probably the tartar sauce, which was pretty good.  But if you're looking for really crisp fish and chips...not the place for you.

yAZvIrC_Meh27qptN26glg.text: Proper fish and chips. Fried to order. The price seemed a bit steep but the portions justified it. The salt and vinegar is a must.

h-FxY6YdlCKv4adjIV3uEQ.text: Ordered a large haddock fish and chips with some mushy peas. The fish was really big and we were able to split it between two people. The fish was really soft and moist. The chips were also excellent with everything not being too oily.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Great fish and chips!

groAB8PpLVkQAB5bnxFEVw.text: BLOODY INCREDIBLE.It is hands down the best fish and chips I have ever had.They served 3 entrees of fish and chips in around 10 minutes.Excellent service.The fish was nice and moist.The chips were too.I recommend coming here every day.

4_4e1F-Jh0ome-F5nYBenA.text: Cue fake British accent.The fish and chips here are quite nice! Located in a central location off Oxford Street, this place was a gem to find. We shopped around on our first day of London and when all the shops closed, we were in search of an authentic fish and chips place to kick start our trip with English feels in our tummy.This place did the trick! The portions are huge and service is great. They did charge us this optional 12.5% service fee which not sure if it's tip or what but says optional? Either way we were much too tired to inquire.Had the cod and chips and a meat pie. Both were delish!!! Would come back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips (LARGE)

vY7nocc2p8zvP4nwdYLcRg.text: We were looking forward to the fish and chips after reading many good reviews and recommendations. Unfortunately was very disappointed in the quality of the food and service.Ordered the large cod and chips plus scampi and chips. The batter on the cod was soaked through and thus disintegrated in my hand. The scampi was similarly wet inside and made for an unpleasant eating experience. The fish itself was very high quality but a shame that it didn't come through in the preparation. The chips were fine but have had better at the local pub.To top it off, had to wait a full 10 minutes before the bill came. I would not recommend coming here and will not be coming back again.

nOu4VWdKvFZeTp4lsJNy0Q.text: Came from toronto me and the boys tried like 50 fish and chips , this is easily top 5, get thr large haddock ladies and gents

Q1aYX6Lb_TNFYmNtuHXnpQ.text: Well worth the wait to be seated. There is a line up at lunch times but be patient and you won't be disappointed. The food and service is five star quality. Clean fried, non greasy fish and freshly cut potatoes. I'm so glad we got to eat there even if we were there in a rush only hours before departing from the country.Big thank you to the staff for doing their best to get us served asap so we wouldn't miss our flight.

bkrtDRB7MBcxOwWyBI24wg.text: Very fast, very fresh fish'n'chips.  Tons of options for those who get to regularly eat this stuff, but I stuck to the basics (cod) as it was the first meal after arriving and just wanted some authentic fish'n'chips.  I wasn't disappointed, very good stuff.

yqsM84HsNkU2hnQdLHGsYg.text: Before coming to London, my boyfriend and I knew that we had to try fish and chips somewhere in the city. We researched several options before deciding on Golden Union Fish Bar for a late dinner (9 PM)! It was the only place that wasn't about to close for the day and we were sold by the food pictures on Yelp. It most certainly did not disappoint and I would recommend it to friends looking for a delicious and reasonably priced meal in a hip setting. We ordered: large cod fish and chipsFood: We were both super hungry, so we each ordered a large cod and chips. Note: the large is a LARGE! The cod is gigantic and I'd say that it's good enough for two semi hungry people (or one starving person like myself at the time :P) The fish was flaky, soft, and had a melt-in-your-mouth sort of texture. Freshly fried, light and crispy, with the perfect golden battered crust. The balance between the fish meat and the crust was perfect, and their homemade tartare sauce really sealed the meal, adding a fresh, creamy splash to the mix.Unfortunately, I was too full to enjoy much of the chips, but they looked tasty as well!Ambience: Clean, modern decor with awesome graphics. I love the typography used in their logo as well as the neon signs in the restaurant. Another +1: no fried or fishy odors in the restaurant! We came after the usual dinner hours, so we didn't have to wait for a table. We barely had to wait for the food too, service was quick and the two waiters who served us were friendly and helpful. Another +1: I LOVED the ketchup condiment bottle! It's shaped like a tomato and made my meal a lot more fun :P

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cool neon decor
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large cod and chips!
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Love the typography design of this restaurant

54MH6ewkT-RNBNIwDRjEfw.text: The fried cod we got was beautiful (the fries were meh but it didn't matter to me, we came for the fish!), it was a generous portion of cod and most importantly, lightly battered and fried to perfection (gold, not golden brown).  The problem for me was...without masking the fish in the tartar sauce (and we had to ask for extra because the tiny dollop you get simply wouldn't be enough for that giant filet!), the oil tasted like someone dropped a piece of plastic into it.  It literally smelled like burnt plastic, which was off putting to me.  But otherwise, I would go back to see if this were a fluke, because it's otherwise deserving of 4 or 5 stars.  Pro tip: get the pickled onions and pickles, they're more like relish.  They're slightly sweetened and go perfectly well with the fish.

pTbUkGrMd_ozgQUrL3pkHQ.text: The food was priced about 16 times what it was worth. The service was god awful and the food tasted like a third grader's vomit after accidentally eating playdough.  My god please save your money!

i8sNb_YoHqvEK4mF6Tqd4w.text: My quest to eat fish and chips while in London led me to this hip joint in Soho. We ordered the 12 oz cod and chips, which was massive--plenty for 2 people. I felt a bit sorry for the overwhelmed couple next to us who ordered 2 separate 12 oz dishes. The cod was excellent--light and crunchy crust, fresh melt-in-your-mouth fish, and dense tartar sauce mix on the side. The dash of lemon made it even better. The fries, which looked appetizing and thick, were a bit on the dry and bland side, perhaps overcooked but not crispy at all. But hey, maybe it's an American preference to like your fries greasy, salty, and crispy on the outside/soft on the inside. That's my kind of steak fries. Had the fries not been so bland, I would have given this 5 stars because of atmosphere, value, and great fish. Tip: get the Vedett Extra Blond Lager with your F&C, as recommended by the waiter. Great pairing.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Neon ambiance. Cool vibe
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. 12 ounces of delicious fried cod

lOqnL48mxbwffhk2R3t3wQ.text: Food:  My wife and I ordered the fish and chips, mush peas and baked beans.  The peas were pretty good, everything else tasted pretty decent.Food rating:  3.5/5Service:  The staff here were very friendly.Service rating:  4/5Price:  Expect to pay about $15 for the fish & chips.  The sides were probably around the $5 range.Overall:  This was my 1st legit fish & chip experience.  The service here was good and decent food.

B8tFumVLk6lIe8VECtErYA.text: Very good fish and chips, super fast service. Location is great, right off Oxford St, however the atmosphere left a little to be desired. It's not bad, just somewhat plain. However the food was solid and I'd go back if I was in the area again.

d6QMnoH7ReJ6PIRRotltOQ.text: Amazing fish and chips - I had the cod. Amazing deep fried prawns. Light, shatteringly crunchy batter, perfectly cooked so that the fish was pillowy and flaky and juicy and tender. Tartar sauce is house made, I believe, and studded thickly with bits of pickle.The regular order of fish is 6-8 ounces, for £12.95, while the large is £14.50 for a 10-12 ounceportion. In my piggery and hunger, I opted for the large. I am here to tell you that piece of cod was almost as big as my head!Cute decor, with FISH spelled out in subway tiles on the wall. Free jukebox. Everything is SUPER fresh - there's not even a hint of a whiff of fish or grease in the air, and yet they are frying fish and chips and other things in hot fat all day long. Steps from the Oxford Circus tube stop, steps from Liberty London and Carnaby Street.LOVE. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
