Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. The fish, the prawns, and the pickled things. Mmmmmm......

DsQ_UgFiwmlFrm44DW__-Q.text: Wow. Came to London with friends who had never been before and so thus of course fish and chips were on the main attractions list. I did what I always do - trust and believe in my fellow yelpers - and boyyyyyy y'all didn't let me down. There are multiple options (cod or haddock) and they don't serve small strips they serve the full filet. It's really special. Highly recommended for anyone looking to get their quintessential "im in London so I want fish and chips" experience.

lGyA68XOZZ6Sqsgw9euT_Q.text: Amazing!!!!  Best Fish and Chips.  The tarter sauce, OMG I could of eaten it with a spoon alone it was that good!  Plus our server Kay was remarkable!

hk2_7_9a_nsPxvh5sDfcHA.text: On a trip to London we were looking for something to satisfy our "fish & chips" fix.  I was a bit hesitate given it felt a bit like a chain, but we were very happy with the food.  If we were in the same area on our next trip, we'd consider it again!

nUWuhUM-PDgpPIwbkGbKwA.text: Nice mix of restaurant and chippie feel!

0erEvJR6LvDZ2h82cPDcyw.text: LOVE it here, the service is great and the owner is a lovley man that love the customers and knows your name!!

MyAJw8VDaaNCimy8s2_D9g.text: Ate here yesterday. Family of 6 - between us we had the coley, cod, fishcake, battered sausage and chips. All was lovely. Mine was the coley (£6.95 inc the chips) which was lovely and well worth it. One of the kids had fishcake which kept being sampled by the adults, as it was so nice. Would definitely recommend and return.

Fo22iqcY3WQE4qviPAGsGQ.text: sorry but had chips here and they weren't very nice at all, i went here especially as well. why is it so hard to find a (decent) fish and chip shop in central London!?. As the place was very quiet, (which was odd) i decided i would just get chips.The quietness also meant i suspect they had been put in back in the fryer a number of times and recooked as each customer came in. They were hard and looked like overcooked oven chips. The service was friendly though so its a shame.

hD-BRSlUX9znVp6dY2aUxg.text: Went to golden fish bar, the best chips ive had since leaving my home town cambridge ,20years ago .fish cake was the best had to wait 5mins but it was fresh and the chips was golden brown keep it up ...........x

R1R3Pp7tQjSw5ilUwbqpzg.text: Fantastic fish and chips. An absolute must-go! We were in London for a couple of days and ended up going here twice. The prices are significantly cheaper if you take out though, so if you want to save some coin, just do take out.  The large portion is good for 2. The steak and ale pie was fantastic as well.

wHudRAajy4L5VKT4i1w7sA.text: When I think of London, I think of fish and chips. After watching a video that recommended Golden Union, I had to come.When I got there around 6 in the evening, every table was taken. Since I was a party of 1, I got sat at the bar. I ordered the small haddock and chips at the recommendation of my server. She suggested it because it had more flavor than the cod. Even though I was hungry, the small size was more than enough food. 1 large piece of haddock fried to perfection and a big pile of chips. I really enjoyed the tartar sauce that it was served with. The chips weren't as spectacular as I thought they would be considering the amount of people raving about them on Yelp. To me, they were good, but not great. I prefer chips that are closer to the McDonald's style. These were more wedge-like.The food came quickly and the service was good. For the price, the portions were generous. I would recommend this place to anybody who wants a good fish and chips experience while in London.

zehHY_4r5456YiYzwpRsHg.text: If I did not have fish and chip, I would not consider myself came to London! Chose this place because it has good rating on Yelp! I got here a little later during the night, so there was no line. This restaurant offers free juke box, which seemed to be pretty classic to me! We ordered fish and chips, and shrimp and chips! Fish and chips: the size of the fish was bigger than the plate, and there was a lots of chips! This also comes with tar tar sauce. The fish was not properly seasoned, and it seemed to be tasteless, but the tar tar sauce saved the dish! I overused the tar tar sauce a bit because of the above reason.Shrimp and chips: they gave us 4 shrimps as well as lots of chips that we could not finish. This dish serves with sweet and spicy sauce, and the shrimps went very well with this sauce! Love this place even thought the seasonings were too light. Will come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

zVh8pltB91klynvC7H0JGQ.text: Loved this place! You might have to wait for a table but it is well worth it. I got the large fried haddock with mushy peas. The fish was so flaky and fresh tasting. The outside was super crispy but still very light. They pride theirselves in using high quality oil and changing it regularly and you can really taste it.I would definitely go for the small fish and chips if you're just one person or share the large between 2 people, I couldn't finish the large on my own. The mushy peas were so flavorful and really great with a splash of vinegar. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large haddock and mushy peas

DM0fYpRcK5ez6PXmUxQm5g.text: Since it's a must to try UK's fish and chips whilst there, i decided to try it at Golden Union that's around Oxford circus after some shopping. We came here at around 6pm on a Friday, and we had to queue for around 15 mins. I don't think they allow reservations. There isn't too much seating and there's an area at the front of the restaurant for people to buy take out. Since we weren't really hungry, the two of us shared a large fish (cod) and chips, baked beans, and a milkshake. The fish was very smooth and the batter wasn't too thick! The chips (or fries) weren't our favourite though. Just not quite used to this texture in fries. The milkshake was very yummy though!I'd recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large fish (cod) and chips with baked beans and milkshake
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

3PadgFUz3sMRQ74DujYAWA.text: I love fish and chips so traveling to London could not have been complete without enjoying one of my favorite foods. We went to this particular place just because it was the closest to the center where we were staying.  We ordered cod and haddock to go. I also ordered mushy peas for myself.I was skeptical about the mushy peas at first but they were excellent.  I would totally order them again.  Fish was pretty solid. I am not going to comment on the service. All i can say  is that our food was served.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

a54kZ-5YFmwiiUSiVQlj7Q.text: Came here on a Tuesday night. Waited for like 10mins for table. The waitress was super friendly. We placed our order and it came in like 10mins. I wanted to try the pies but unfortunately they were sold out. We ordered the cod, hallock, and the shrimp scampi. The fishes were fried perfectly and the fish was flakey. Usually when i order fish and chips the fish is super oily and you can taste the oil it was fried in. It was not the case here. The strawberry milkshake was so good. The waitress gave us some curry sauce to try and said most people don't really like it but we loved it. Reminded us of Japanese curry. Also got the pickled egg which is an acquired taste!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

wwl8vSB8ddyUosCUbamLZg.text: Someone recommended Golden Union Fish Bar during a quick day trip to London. Got there close to 12pm and there was a short line to dine in. Waited about 15/20 minutes to be seated. There isn't too much seating available and the table are quite close together. Regardless, none of this bothered us as we were eager to eat! Got the large cod fish and chips with a side of mushy peas. Personally, I like peas a lot, and these were pretty great peas. The fish was not overly fried and fish quality was great. I did not feel like I was drowning in an oil vat after eating. The chips were... ok. Thicker cut and soft. I wish the chips were crispier on the outside. My favorite part of the whole meal was their tartar sauce. So delicious - it added so much to the dish. Seemed to be a popular spot for tourists. By the time we left around, there was a line out (and blocking) the door. Worth trying for reasonably priced, quality fish!

k1S8C9HNtepRbTBKwZV8Pw.text: I almost never order fish and chips at home, but when in Rome, or in this case, London... This place basically ONLY sells fish and chips.  Different kinds of fish but essentially the same.  Upon arrival, it's set up like a fast food joint, but if you want to do dine in instead of "take away", just walk down the only walkway and you'll be seated in the back.  We had the haddock and chips and it was delicious.  The batter was perfect and the fish was soft; not chewy at all.  Chips in UK are a little different than in the States.  It tastes as if they fried them first and then re-fried them when ordered.  That's not to say they aren't good; just different than what I am used to.  The large order was more than enough for two persons.  We also had the heinz baked beans; like the stuff from a can.  Nothing to write home about.  Service wasn't too bad and they even have a free jukebox! So if you are looking for a fish and chip place, this is it.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Awesome ketchup bottle!

V2NGeYttYHsg4KTalPnYdA.text: This place is HANDS DOWN the best freaking piece of fried fish in Piccadilly and beyond! I mean GODDAMN, it was the size of Chile and it was flaky and HOT and FRESH, so fresh!! And light and crunchy and really EVERYTHING you could ever want in a fish and a chip! The flavor was immaculate. Also GET THE HADDOCK. It's far and away the best. If you don't get the tarter sauce to go with it you're a DANG FOOL! Sometimes the staff clues you in on this but a lot of people aren't shown "the way" and if you don't do this thing right, it could be the difference between a Home run and a grand slam! Get the tarter sauce and make it a grand slam!!! Also the large and the small size fish aren't much different in size but they're definitely different in price so if you think you can eat a lot get the small, if you think you can eat as much an elephant on steroids with a thyroid condition get the large.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. The "large" haddock! SO delicious and SO MUCH FOOD!

a2OTcLjUQJ7QxEmzOQj6aA.text: The fish is freshly fried to order and it comes in HUGE portion!  That's a plus.  My husband usually munches up everything on his plate but he couldn't finish the chips on his large Haddock and Chips.  I had the Pollock and Chips and also couldn't finish the Chips.  The batter was light but it's unflavourful.  The homemade tartar sauce was a disappointment as it didn't add any flavour to the fish.  The Chips were very good. I picked out 3 bones from my pollock, and again, that's a disappointment as well.  Generally speaking, if I were to have Fish and Chips in London, Golden Union wouldn't be my first choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Pollock & Chips
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large Haddock and Chips

OWUU0G_lJOxN2I9HrNLfEQ.text: 5 STARS for food; 1 STAR for service.Great Fish & Chips! I ordered the Large Haddock and the fish was fried perfectly golden brown and crispy yet somehow amazingly not greasy at all. They don't overspice the fish, so you'll have to add salt/pepper/vinegar yourself and season to your own liking.While the food itself is great, the service leaves much to be desired. I ordered a drink and the waitress did not bring it to my table until 15 minutes later.  When I proceeded to ask for water, she nodded at me and I never saw her again for the duration of my meal, let alone that glass of H2O.I saw 4 other tables trying to flag this same waitress down for their bill, but she ignored them  and pretended to not see anyone.Definitely Annoying! So I proceeded to the front counter and paid for my meal since I didn't want to waste any more time trying to get her attention.

HpGkJqCbnGqiRJARDl3I9A.text: 2nd time in London but 1st time at this joint with the husband and family. We didn't have to wait but they had to split us up to table of 4 and table of 2 (there were 6 of us). Food came rather quick, they cook per order so we were prepared to wait. The cod was amazingly crispy, flaky, and fresh. The large was huge and small was perfect for me. The strawberry smoothie was also delicious but was a bit too small. I'd definitely come back and it is a must for fish and chips!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Small cod and chips, amazing!!!
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Half drank strawberry milkshakebecause it was too good to wait

8OnxoBIHkHZV-gqzWAlyPw.text: The food is so delicious here! We split a large haddock and chips and got some mushy peas. I read some of the reviews dogging the mushy peas...but seriously, WTF do people want with mushy peas!? It's British baby food. And they were great, by the way, don't believe the haters. Fish was crispy and delicious, chips were thick and not mushy. Do it. Best fish I've had for sure. Only negative was service that was a bit slow. Very friendly, but just sort of spaced out, especially when you're trying to pay.

Qh8WkUD6iHhWNgTwOAl0Ew.text: I enjoyed my fish and chips here, I really liked the fact you can get a few different varieties of fish here. Options are always a plus. I had the traditional cod, it had a nice batter that hasn't too think. The fish tastes fresh and you can see them dipping then frying it. The chips aka fries are a little thicker and pretty good. This is a good place to choose how you experience fish and chips, it's a very popular fish here in London and this location was very busy when we went, the locals seem to enjoy this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

BBanl29j2QYF3W5ryqOTPA.text: Brilliant fish & chips. Fresh cod, tender & juicy, with light crispy batter, and good fries. The large cod could be shared between two persons. We would have ordered one small cod and one small haddock, but they were out of small haddocks. The waiter kept wiping the sweat from his brow, considerate not to drip on our table. The workers are hard-working and friendly enough. Next time I'll order the haddock (other fish are on the menu as well).

1CpUBCgO9o8J3vutLnMvNA.text: Best fish n chips in London! Hidden in a small spot right off Oxford St. The fish batter was soooo flaky! Excellent creamy tartar sauce. Handmade chips made fresh daily. Perfect mushy peas. Your choice of cod, haddock, pollock, plaice and more! The large cod or haddock are HUGGGGGE And the Steak pie is amazing! So juicy & succulent. Ample seating in the back passed the take away counter with table service. The line/ wait can get long during busy times but goes by fast as the servers turn the tables pretty quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Steak pie
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Small cod & chips

fV4xA19RCWBwRHAovApRDg.text: Huge Fried Fish. HUGE! But quantity isn't the best thing here. Although the fish took up the entire plate, I can't say it was anything special. Very under seasoned fish. The fries was cut too thick for my preferences. Overall, we were kind of disappointed with this London staple food. Location was in a small random alley, finding it was sort of tough.

chmcvzDgmQ4up_RXzBEh6A.text: We were looking for a good place to try authentic fish and chips- and this place did not disappoint. You can tell that the fish is fresh and the tartar sauce was so cravable!The price was a little more than we expected but the portions were very generous. I definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. I like the ketchup bottles!
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cute Diner Feel inside!
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips! (Haddock)

zNX_l2j5-QlKSX2zYIxRBQ.text: I am a big fan of fish, but I never usually order fish and chips. It seemed WAY too oily for me. But then I went to GOLDEN UNION FISH BAR and all my previous thoughts about fish and chips were erased. For 3 girls, we got 2 "Large" sized Fish & Chips and we didn't even finish it all. The fish pieces are really big and there are a lot of chips. The best part about the dish is the deep fried fish, Its not a heavy batter at all and the fish is so soft! The tartar sauce goes well with the fish too! Got a light beer and my meal was perfect :)We waited about 20 minutes on a sunday after shopping on Oxford St and had really great service. Kind of pricey, but its London and in a touristy spot.I would come back and I want to tell all my friends to eat here! Craving NOW! YUMM

s3ZKmHSCoL1W6S11tCsV6w.text: good fish and chips.  classic feel, fairly fresh fish, a little on the greasy side.  My fav is still Golden Hind

QhV-A6UGjbha1GO_9e9nVg.text: Stopped by here for some lunch while I was out shopping in the Oxford St. area.  Was seated promptly (although they were very adamant about where you could and could not sit) and of course ordered up some fish and chips.  Came pretty quick and definitely bigger than I thought it was going to be.  It was good tasting too but I think it had been pre-cooked and under a heater for a bit as although it was good, to me, it was far from anything to write home about. Did love that their drinks were normal priced, I hate when places try to charge you 2£ or more for a can of soda.Will for sure keep it in mind next time I'm in the area for some cheap sit-down (or takeout) eats but I'd only count this place as a 5.5 on my fish and chips rictor scale. Take it as you may!

2zVJ1gzXYzV1k-08b_U5kg.text: Very nice fish and homemade tartar sauce! Both are very fresh makes the whole experience a great food experience. My wife took the haddock and I took the cod and I must admit that I found that the haddock tasted better. Nothing to do with the freshness of the fish, it's just that cod is a little bland after trying the haddock. The staff is friendly and efficient and the place does not smell fishy or greasy. They did a great job. We were a little disapointed with the chips. They were good but not great. Overall, a great place and well worth a visit. Very affordable, good quality and friendly service.

Jp1dMUS5C0uWVrj_FJu8hg.text: P.E.R.F.E.C.T.! But why oh why the short opening times?

Z-KSwz_6WITpXWm4RORt3Q.text: Portion size is massive, unless you are eating for two order the small.  The fish is fried upon ordering and comes to the table hot.  The chips/fries taste of real potatoes and they are nice mix of firm and crunch.  Tarter sauce is extra, but worth the price.

ChS3Waw_THlQqYcvM_PQhA.text: This is my fish and chip place.  I'm usually around the area and if not it's close to everything.  Great fish and chips with great prices, usually a couple pounds cheaper than a lot I've seen.They do a battered sausage there that I can't justify getting everything, health wise, but it's great.One other huge plus is a great seating area and an efficient take out line.  Great if you have time or not.Nice staff.

d9TWpMB1sRNgvdOvASdoOA.text: Found this spot on the "time out" magazine. Service was food, fish n chips were tasty. Had a nice thick vanilla shake with it. No crowds on a late Friday afternoon.

Eb_N1Y8ZUK-dVdFmxNa4Lg.text: we think the haddock was the best 'fish' in a 'fish and chips' weve ever had - perfectly cooked, and not at all greasy. The chips were very good, as well. Fast and friendly service. Pricey, but normal by London standards - order a 'large' and split it. Only quibble is that there's only 1 WC - there was a line almost the entire time we were there.

IgsLXZ_NGcBQaKbAe3HDpQ.text: Just under a tenner for fish chips,  so expensive. But very clean and bright. Food was top notch, best fish & chips I remember having.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

KAraFoOnD6I0f1zyFzftVQ.text: Gutted I haven't found this place before. An absolute gem of a chippy in a sea of tourist traps and crap fast food joints. Top marks for actually getting fresh fish out of the fridge, then battering (I think thats the word!) and frying it while I waited. Was also impressed by their effort to push cheaper, but more ecologically friendly fish, such as the Coley (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Po…) - which was actually much more succulent and delicately flaky than your average Cod. Has a nice seating area out the back, and they also have a drinks license if you feel the need to wash down your fish with a bottle of beer. Can't wait to go back.

ZcWr2jqnm9togrtNqWrjRg.text: Great food, huge portions.  The wife and I plan on visiting here at least once more on this visit - but pehaps we'll just split a large plate instead of each getting our own.

E4LJonb96kYMkQvBUDDN9w.text: I love me some fish and chips!  We were craving a proper chippie before starting our shopping day on Oxford St.  This place didn't seem like a lot when we say it, but it had all of the standard fish n' chip shop fare.I had the haddock and chips.  It was cooked perfectly and the portion size was good for the price.  This is a great place to go for lunch if you're around Oxford St.

HyqwQke8QJ6l7z3FdTnf6g.text: Best Fish & Chips we've ever had.Fish was beautiful and fresh.Batter was crispyChips were good as were the mushy peasTartare and curry sauces really goodService was great

cVVXQarWRFHzxmDjK3WcsQ.text: If you want fish n chips 'seriously' this is your place. No frills, just plain good food. Try the home made tartare sauce. The service was excellent, very friendly and helpful.

03TTVjL0ExAeNwjCOW4X4A.text: Best fish & chips ever!  Even my kids, who hate fish, loved this place.  Simple & perfectly done.  Wait staff is wonderful.  You won't go wrong here!

SHuEAeZ1Fy72OpWYQawLZA.text: Sweet and very accommodating staff serve up lightly battered and very crispy cod. Mushy peas melt in your mouth. Expect the best of an iconic London meal. If I lived in London, I'd be a regular.

You0URu4Hzuw9BmfC8Mz8g.text: Fish and chips to me are a gluttonous feast of too much food. The fish here was thick and meaty and cooked to perfection. The chips were fresh and nice as well. For £6.10 in central London - we are talking Soho here people just off Oxford St! - this is a really good place. They also have a generous seating area. I have to admit, I was a smidgen disappointed that on the cold day I went the chips were not more plentyful but my bum and hips are probably smaller as a result. Not as good as my local, of course, but great nontheless.

1SBQDpDC-VB8Fyt2AZEnvw.text: Excellent fish and chips in a cool environment. The tartar sauce is just awesome.

8AphUo49mDBzwIUXOnPjwQ.text: Great value, good quality and consistent. Friendly service (when not too busy ;/) and good space to eat and chat early evening in Soho to get away from the madding crowds...

w3GNfy9W9VfWTxnF78h6Gw.text: Fish & chips in Soho! A new place, looking like a proper old-fashioned 50s fish and chip emporium. There's quite a large seating area as well as takeaway. OK, so it's not going to be Northern standard, but it's very good for London.

B-udY_Y99D9gJB_o7sFohA.text: Amazing!! Best fish and chips in London!!My Order: haddock & chips with side of baked beans and Coke ZeroEnvironment: looks like a five guys restaurant but don't let it fool you, it serves the best fish and chips you can have!!Verdict: absolutely worth it! Must go back and have again!! Everything was fantastic.  Juicy and tender fish that had a delicious flaky but solid fried batter around it. Fries were perfect temperature and crispness.Tips: baked beans are vegetarian . Next Time: same order and try some other options too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Ketchup bottle
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu

Hu7HAuq-LBWlvEnSJdvZSg.text: Fish & chips in London is a must when you visit.  We were headed to a show and grabbed a bite to eat at Golden Union prior.  There was no wait and seated immediately.  I decided to go with the fish bites and chips so that I could try both the haddock and the cod.  We were also hoping for a steak and ale pie but they ran out.  We went with the last chicken & mushroom pie instead. Ok, the fish & chips.  My fave out of the 2?  The cod.  The batter was also very light and crispy.  Gave it a little douse of vinegar and their homemade tartar sauce.  Still found it plain though.  The fries were ok as I've had better in London.  Also found them to be plain.  Do people ever finish these plates though?  They are absolutely huge!  The chicken and mushroom pie was a great complement if you were tired of the fried stuff.  Apparently, they make all their pies in house so I am appreciative of that.Service was great.  They were absolutely on top of things and super friendly.  I'd definitely like to check out other places in London for fish & chips but I did have a decent experience here.

Q9n0PY-G6oiMcNgn8_9paQ.text: No respected foodcation to London would be complete without fish and chips.I had several shops on my radar, but decided to go with Golden Union.Large order of haddock, mushy peas, a gherkin and chips. The gherkin was much larger than I expected. About the size of a small pickling cucumber. It was juicy with a soft texture. I personally would have preferred more crunch and a more pronounced lacto-fermented flavor. The mushy peas are mushy indeed. They are about the consistency of a thick pudding and taste like fresh peas. Not a lot of complexity in and of themselves, I did not detect any spices or mint involved. A small amount of tartar sauce was provided. Nice and creamy. Has a subtle sweetness with a pickle tang. Fresh ground black peppercorn. Now the chips are thick, but have a very mild crunch. Not much flavor going on here nor anything exciting texture wise. Requires ketchup. The haddock has a fresh quality apparent in its succulent and delicately flaky meat. Beer batter crust is soft, light and sticks the fish. No batter slip here! In terms of quality and technique this is pretty, pretty good.My issue is mainly the flavor. Outside of the slight ale undertone from the batter and the mild haddock flavor, the use of condiments is necessary if one seeks nuance or complexity. Tartar sauce does quite well in this regard, but as the amount I was given is small I quickly ran out. Now, on the table, one will find salt, malt vinegar, and ketchup. I tried applying salt and vinegar. The salt and vinegar seem readily absorbed into the batter crust, but the change in flavor was barely perceptible. Perhaps I didn't add enough salt or vinegar. I ultimately found myself using ketchup as a flavor enhancer.I realize the bland nature of the dish is a bit intentional and traditional. Chips are serviceable but lack an addicting taste and texture.  The craft and quality on the haddock is truly commendable, from the meat to the batter. Thus, despite my desire for more flavor, Golden Union fries a fish fillet worth taking a detour for.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Mushy Peas.
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Gherkin.
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large Haddock and Chips.

oQZrh8lM0PwCacyiOvYRxQ.text: We were told to have to have fish & chips while in London,  and we did. Got hungry while shopping on Oxford St. This restaurant is located on a side street edith easy access to get to. They have a take out order line and then seating further inside.  We ordered what was most popular, cod & chips. I ordered a small with a sparkling water and the hubby had a large with an iced tea. It looked,  smelled and tasted delicious! Portions were huge, like the hubby didn't finish his huge. Can check this off or bucket list now. It's a legit place for fish & chips. The crowd seemed happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large cod & chips

HF5psns7NKn4GfDupMauAQ.text: Not sure what the hype is about. It was decent, but not seasoned at all- as in not salted! I don't like salty food and never add salt to my food, but the fish was incredibly bland and under-salted. My friends thought the same of theirs. I definitely had much better fish and chips elsewhere in London.

nvU5B6P34rIkCyV_iybskw.text: Located off really busy Oxford Circus, this place was easy to find. Fish and chips are a comfort food to me and if it is available in a coastal town, I will order it. The fish and chips here are an enormous portion. A small order of fish comes on a pretty large plate. It looked to me like a whole size of fish! The mushy peas are something to try but left little to be desired.Overall, I found the taste to just be okay. I've definitely had better in the states, and especially in Iceland. I'm a sucker for chips, so I found myself eating more chips than actual fish. All in all, I was a tad disappointed. The fish did taste better with malt vinegar! Unfortunately, after this my fiance and I got sick almost immediately. This is not ideal because public restrooms are scarce in the area! =X This only made the whole experience more unappealing.

QKdm5cyUNoYzxyo4jBIWeQ.text: I tried this place based on Yelp reviews. Although I wanted to try Fish and Chips a couple times, I ended up only trying this place, so I can only compare it to ones in the United States in places like Seattle and California.I ordered for take away, right where you walk in. The options are on the left and a la carte. The one thing that popped out to me was the need to pay for tartar sauce.So once you get a fish, chips and sauce, it was £12. A little pricey compared to other ones I saw in the city.So was it worth it?It was very good...but not unbelievably amazing. I had better chips at other places during my trip. And since I did not dine in, I had wished they put more malt vinegar on it. They also did not include a lemon.I wish I could say it was better or worse than all the other shops around, but on it's own, it is satisfying.

tD86BMYIK_Ha2152Cre0RQ.text: This was hubby and I first meal in London. Due to a snow storm in Atlanta our flight was two hours longer than it should have been (10-11 hours vs 8-9). Both of us do not eat airplane food so by the time we arrived, we were starving!We checked into our hotel and headed straight to soho area to eat and shop (we prefer to pick light and buy clothes at the destination). Being hubby first time in London he naturally wanted to eat fish and chips. This place was closest to where we were shopping (Oxford street) that night according to yelp so we walked over here. The inside is small with a take out area in the front and seating in the back. This place was packed so we knew the food would be good. I love the retro diner decor feel We got lucky and didn't have to wait for a table since a table was just leaving as we arrived. But later that night there was a small line. Both hubby and I ordered the standard cod fish and chips with a beer. Very affordable around 13-15p depending if you get a larger size. The fish was so good! Crispy and light despite being deep fried. The warmth of the dish was perfect on the cold winter night. The hint of sweet barley taste from the crispy beer batter with the light fluffy cod texture inside was a deadly combo. The fish tasted fresh. And fries/chips? Every girl likes fries!! This is probably the best British fish and chips I have had in London. I highly recommend. It's casual dining, affordable, fast, and delicious. y

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

iCxcQZ8QOOYVVwVXXzJShw.text: It's strange looking spot from outside, but inside it looks like five guys (burger place). But their fish and chips is AMAZING. If you would search for top Fish and Chips places in London this one almost always would come up in top 10. Only small trick, if you want to save then do take out, you will get crazy big fish for 9.50 , but sit down is 15.50. Service when sit down is fast and polite. (In and out in 30 -45 min)We didn't have any wait time to get seated, but be ready to wait for 5-15 min if it's a rush time.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

POl9Dd2lA5lQiUGp3glo2w.text: The one thing that I wanted to make sure I ate while in London was a properly prepared fish and chips.  I had did a search on Yelp to help me out with this and after looking at multiple places I decided on here.  When you enter you are entering an authentic city establishment.  Greeted by a counter that kind of guides you to the dining area.  The setup almost reminds you of a diner setting.  Once I was seated I looked over the menu rather quickly because I didn't really care about what else was offered, I already knew I wanted fish and chips.  However, I did ask the server what her take on the best option was.  Without hesitation she had said I should try the haddock and chips.  So without me hesitating, that's what I ordered.  I'm not sure what I was expecting for fish and chips, but when they arrived I was surprised by the serving size.  This piece of fish barely fit on the plate.  The breading on the fish was amazing, perfect amount of crunch factor, give it a spritz of lemon and you can dive in.  I will admit that I was a bit leery of tartar sauce in general, but I figured why not give it a try.  Was I ever glad I did.  I'm not sure how they prepare their tartar sauce but it was so flavorful.  Having that mix with the fish and touch of lemon was an extraordinary blast of flavor.  Needless to say, but that fish didn't last long on the plate, no matter the size.The chips, oh my god, the chips.  I felt as if I had died and gone to heaven.  I am such a potato person and I couldn't help but gobble these chips up.  So fresh.  I usually don't use ketchup due to allergies, but I couldn't resists here.  Plus the bottle was irresistible to not use.  I mean, come on, a tomato shaped ketchup bottle, this makes you want to use it.The staff were amazing and attentive.  I didn't have many questions while I was here but they did answer every question I had with ease.  And I must have timed it just right when I arrived here as the place was nearly empty.  So service was fast and the atmosphere was great.

Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips.

Ir1E1TJJ5ZDCIB7xKBZq_Q.text: I guess I'm not a big fun of fish and chips . Ordered cod fish and chips because my mate told me it's the signature plate. It was not bad, but the cod fillet was a little bit over cooked in my opinion... .

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

sdaYrcFfuNdFp1pGZVkZ_w.text: Perfect fish (haddock) and chips with delicious tartare sauce (although it should be a lot bigger). So light, flakey, perfectly seasoned, and not greasy. Yum!!! I would skip the mushy peas next time.

zL5rvg-y-6uuVWNHm0TYlg.text: Love this place! Fun little spot in Soho with a free jukebox. Really good fish and chips. And drinks! I had the cod, one friend had the shrimp and the other had haddock. No complaints from any of us!  Well, one friend complained about the chips but they were fine to me (probably because they had delicious organic ketchup).

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

0ZWFAWj2TZ3_V-rJ6ULrjA.text: My husband and I went to London as our first city on our honeymoon, and our first meal in London was here at Golden Union. We both had never been to London before so of course we had to get fish and chips! This restaurant was recommended by a friend, and it did not disappoint! We ordered the Haddock & Chips as well as the Rock Salmon & Chips. Both dishes were delicious; the fish was nicely breaded and the portions were a moderate size. We unfortunately did not get to try the homemade mushy peas (also recommended to us by a friend) because our waiter forgot to put in our order so maybe that just means we will have to return to try it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Rock Salmon & Chips
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Outside sign
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Haddock & Chips in the back; Rock Salmon & Chips in the front

zvxHUaEBPw7PeH-osXslGg.text: Best fish and chips in London.  Get the small size, unless you're trying to kill yourself with Cod.  The fried sausage is a must.

4JOrNydFTKZFubW3T7QnOQ.text: Came here based off the Yelp reviews and everyone telling me to try the fish and chips in London. I'm guessing it is something of a specialty out there because there were a lot of other locations we passed before selecting this place. I ordered the Haddock and chips because the server suggested it was the best tasting. It was such a large serving for a small order. (Check my picture). It's a small area but seems pretty busy. You walk in passing the kitchen and notice all the signs stating they make everything fresh to order which is nice to know. You wait about 5 minutes while your table gets prepared. Food comes out with a bit of a wait but understandable since it's super fresh. My first impression was that the batter was nice and crispy but light tasting compared to the fried items you get in the states. Chips we're also the same in my option but really good paired with ketchup. The fish was a perfect pick for me because it was nice and flaky with a tad buttery taste. It was not what I expected since everyone raved about it. The batter although good was not really flavorful. I added lemon, vinegar, and tarter sauce to amp it up a bit which was good but it still felt something was missing. Maybe on my next visit I'll just try one at the train station because they are alot cheaper and I feel like i would get the same quality. Quick tip: takeout is a bit cheaper than dining in. They print out receipts with no place to add tip so I'm guessing service charge is included in the done in charge. Also, if you pay by card they bring the credit card machines to the table and it's all done in front off you. Super easy and fast. We need that out in the states!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. This is a Small Haddock  fish and chips. Couldn't finish it all
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Condimants...tomato is too cute
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu and fish options

VJjNXg3W87BL27kn2Mux6w.text: My first food stop in England was this little fish and chips spot recommended by a friend and it did not disappoint. Atmosphere was pretty cool. Service was friendly and fast. And most importantly, the food was good. We got the large size haddock which was definitely enough for the bf and I to split. The chips were perfectly crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

g_oHQ8lgSpg96LmkSqWTQg.text: Visiting London for first time. A London must eat!Fantastic Fish n chips! Great service, friendly, clean. A gem just of if Oxford Street!!Get the small it's huge!Fresh cod, lightly battered almost like tempura-- amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

4r3vcIv-hTAAH4veDBAaPg.text: Decent fish and chips.  However, nothing amazing.  With so many good fish and chips places to try in London I don't think we would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

DRm60BiE2pdCI6HPLk6Fkg.text: A trip to London would not be complete without fish and chips.  So here we are after going through a Top Ten fish and chips recommendation.We had the cod, haddock and plaice.  The batter were the same fluffy and crispy beer batter.  Quite greasy.  The cod is buttery and juicy, but lacks flavor.  The haddock has better flavor but is drier.  The plaice is huge, but a bit fishy for me and not as juicy as the cod.I am not a fan of the fries here at all.  I prefer crispier versions.The portions are enormous.  I was stuffed to the brim with just a Small.The mushy peas and pickle was interesting to try a little bit of.My London host said this is the best fish and chips she have had (and she have tried many fish and chips here).  I had surprisingly better fish and chips in both USA and New Zealand.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cod Fish and Chips (small) - enormous portions!!

2whvgPCUEzCHx5sEuIJj9w.text: This place is way over priced  for sit down, but take away is a little better. We had the small serving of haddock and one of cod. The fish was fresh enough and plenty of it, but  at 12 British pounds you can get a much better meal at sit down.  There was also a mouse running around. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. The low score is just due to the price and the rodent.

iULBECsrhjSOcBbL6HkrYg.text: I've seen cheaper spots but this was my first fish&chip stop in good ol london! I read about it in one of many touristy books I have, and I just had to try it. It took me a second to find because I was still getting used to the maps and they recently changed their name! So it wasnt entirely my fault. They used to be called Chippy's fyi.I ordered the cod/chips for take-away (its cheaper that way since they charge more if you sit in!) & it was soooo delicious! It was very crispy and downright freshhh. It's definitely better than what I've had in the states.I chatted with the girl while she fried up my baby, and she was such a sweet heart! We were just talking about where we were both from, how she thought I was so brave for moving to london and everything. She even gave me the freshhomemade tartar sauce on my way out. I need to go back just to say hi to amy girl :)

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

bq1JdZCpi0hnFZ2lDKmmMA.text: Fantastic service: very sweet staff who were attentive, made good recommendations, and work well together.  The haddock was some of the best I've had and was very fresh and moist.  "Small" plate was filling and just right.

dyHsWGjtvtUARZPypxkmng.text: Very expensive for what it is (dine-in). I ordered the large portion of Haddock & chips, which was decent -- the star here is the fish batter. I also had mushy peas & a side of curry sauce (neither were very impressive.) The service was attentive & good, however my wife and I easily could have shared the one order -- so I wish the server had given a heads up. Two plates, mushy peas, tartar & curry dipping sauces = £32.  (After their included 12.5% service fee).  Take away seemed to be about half the price, which we didn't realize until after the hefty bill. If anything, opt for that.

9-QCNqsOr5LZS098P9YnJA.text: Perfect!  Amazing cod with crisp light batter.  Good chips and side of mushy peas.  And they have good beer- had a bottle of sambrooks brewery Wandle golden bitter.  For being in such a touristy area, really good food.  Not fancy, just a hole in the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. That's the small cod and chips!

obiItYqc9PC4C5yV4sUEaA.text: A proper british fish & chips. Very good, prepared on order. Do put vinegar and salt in your chips.

o7fZWa2BO7UXINMIS35org.text: A coworker buddy of mine dragged us to this spot, proclaiming it to be the best chippie in our neck of the woods, for both quality and price.  I've previously championed Rock and Sole Plaice in Covent Garden for their impressive offering, but their fish are evidently stolen from the queen's backyard pond because they are mighty expensive.Not Golden Union!  Even a small (ha!) portion is a monstrous fillet of fish, their thick cut golden chips piled high next to it, all for not quite 9 quid which is a full 4 quid less than R&SP.  Sweet.  Their tartar sauce is also hard to beat, as are the bubbly and extravagantly happy waitresses who look like they take pleasure in their patrons.  The decor of the place is nothing special, kind of a 70's vibe and looks like it could very well date that far back without a makeover, but there's no grunge,  and there's ample seating in the back.I will give a very small nudge to R&SP, as their batter might just have a little je ne sais quoi over Golden Union, but overall GU takes my current top place for quality AND value.

Ix4-ZHbM8ab7GQQ0Kzo6zg.text: I'm American in search of fish and chips. I made a few stops during a trip to London and Golden Union was by far the best. The friend fish was golden, flaky and light, not drenched in  heavy oil like others. They change their oil severaly times a week which is much more often than the normal fry place.

Idikhul9MgmSpEF6TQlOAg.text: Great fish and chips, always tastes fresh with nice crisp chips and you don't stink of fat afterwards. Seems like they try to source their fish ethically which is a bonus. Remember to try some curry sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

yVDmfiNVWnLDOpq8yr29iA.text: This is a very cozy place. The portions are generous and quality is good. I had cod and chips; neither were greasy, which was nice change from my usual chip shop. They ran out of steak and ale pie. The food generally looked good and not like it'd been sitting there for ages.  This was a yummy place! Definitely recommend it if in soho and in the mood for a chip shop. :)

D2tShLrJoPxxBSGYJO9JAA.text: Absolutely a gem of a place for fish and chips in central London! The place looks like a canteen, but you do get service from a lone waitress/waiter, and you can see your fish being freshly fried while you wait. They run a special fish and chip of the day with a different fish each day for only £4.90, a bargain in my opinion! The small size portion is already massive, the large will probably feed two or more people! The chips were good, but not the highlight, but the fish was just amazing and fresh. They also do the standard cod and chips or haddock and chips for £6.10, a bit more, but still very reasonable for central London.

n2aLYYtkXzmVv1imsj4LHA.text: Fish and chip is a traditional institution, I'm surprised at how many places get it so wrong. However, you won't be disappointed in the least. Light and crispy battered cod served with an over-sized portion of hand cut chips. Be the envy of your colleagues if you eat out!

L3-729sL2SKFVecbSjdhkA.text: First fish and chips experience in London and I have to say it was delish! I had the salmon... It was flavorful and perfectly crisp. I ordered the honey comb milkshake as well and it wasn't up to standard. It literally tasted like milk with a bit of froth.

Y7-Vv8zCRp-AAQ62SxCNLQ.text: Holy cow this fish is good.  Every time I'm in London, this is on the list.

8yiryCimz8XWcfFym61apQ.text: Excellent fish. I got take away, and the guy at the counter patiently explained everything to me. Fish is made-to-order; the batter was crispy and flavorful. But special attention needs to be paid to the tartar sauce - I'm going to dream of that on my flight home. It went perfect with the fish and chips and had the right texture.

EIqYJ2AJn3OYQ7rhUG3AnA.text: When I saw the 4 star reviews for a fish and chips place right off of Oxford St., I didn't believe it. We were in the area though and in the mood for some fish and chips, so we checked it out.You can get take away or dine in. Prices are a little bit higher if you dine in. They had 3 or 4 different kinds of fish -- cod, haddock, coley and may some others. You can get it in small or large. Even the "small" is quite large, so unless you're a fatty, I'd recommend the small for most folks, especially if you're getting additional sides such as the delicious mushy peas.I tried the coley because it was the cheapest. The fish itself was okay but not as tasty as the haddock that my wife got. The batter was very good on both -- not too greasy and cooked just right. Their tartar sauce is homemade and some of the best tartar sauce I've had. They do offer beer, but only bottled beer. I believe they also offer wine.I would definitely go here again.

H9OKTk__YQNkY7xiyn_XUw.text: You will be tempted by a wide range of other goodies, if you are not a big fan of the fish. But try their crunchy specials. The rich flavours of the homemade pies will make you dream of this place day after day.

5u_KEm0xUuFt9cC7_imF3w.text: Chips are nice and crispy and not soggy like other places. Fish is also good and combined with the chips you get an excellent lunch for a reasonable price. The place is also suitable for a nice dinner with friends or family.

n-sADnGM7lXur4uPM4ryTA.text: Great fish and chips! Really enjoyed the atmosphere, chilled, with the Olympics quietly playing in the background. We ordered a Cod and Chips; the cod was well battered and the chips were just right. Mushy peas, fish and chips with homemade tartar sauce, and a beer to top it off is the classic English meal! The staff and service was excellent - very friendly and helpful. Will come again :)

XIXAu-nmWxECvXzsCrVlxQ.text: The spot is a dive, but its the best fish and chips I've ever had. The batter is light and crispy with just the right amount of grease without overpowering the fish. Speaking of the fish, there was plenty of it and it came out hot and fresh. The portions are extremely large so I'd recommend ordering a small.

5coUQBhp3uIzdTEHvDTM_A.text: Friendly staff. I think they fry everything in oil with some lard because the fish and chips are extra rich, flavorful, and delicious

HlWXIK59ODp4tHEIKINziw.text: Nice, perfect location and delicious dishes. Love the cod and chip. last meal in UK and this is good!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

aivWqdfEEjRbApUD0o0R3g.text: My first taste of fish and chips. Fish was lightly battered and extraordinarily fresh. Excellent taste. Grilled fish was equally fresh, light, and moist. The chips are fresh potato french fries. The mushy peas were also excellent.

N4ItKkA3ssAmDerl90S5vg.text: Best seafood I had in London. The small is a very generous fish portion.  Fish was fresh. Batter was light and crisp.  Chips could have been crisper.  Fast service but they did not rush us to leave even with a large line / queue.

Pe5hAGhCKmE36y8dDK_wCg.text: Execellent COD & CHIP! Dont forget to order their tartar sauce as well (add up a bit of vinegar would be nice as well. Just try!)Big portion even for the small plate. No wifi. (Just talk to others in real life for a change LOL)

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

DACDNRA9HJg0jxT2klk0GQ.text: Whenever I'm in London I make a point of visiting the Golden Union Fish Bar. Typical British fish and chips - you can choose a large or small portion, though there's not much difference in price, so I always go for large haddock and chips. Don't forget to order mushy peasxas a side. Finish off with a nice cup of English tea! Great!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. The fish isfried to order, so it's always fresh.
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. No doubt that the serve fish here

7UkTAa_V6uZTexOeVABK0w.text: I was staying in the area, so I stopped by based on the reviews, and was not disappointed at all! Take my review with a grain of salt since I'm a relatively inexperienced American in this particular cuisine, but the cod was delicious, properly crispy on the outside and meaty on the inside. I ordered the small, which was plenty for my normally huge appetite - I saw someone get the large and it looked like a massive meal. Mushy peas were very satisfying, and the Guinness and fries/chips definitely helped me meet my carb goal for the day.Service was super friendly!

ROH53wH_Ksr53-DmM8BfDg.text: Solid 4 stars! Definitely the best place for fish and chips in the city. We found this gem by looking at Yelp reviews! Once walking in there is a line for take out,  the line was long and popular. But my hubby and I opted to dine in. We found out it's a lot more expensive to dine in than take out. Almost half the price! But it was worth it and service was good. We were seated by a waitress, the servers there did not seem like they were from London ( can tell by the accent) but they were so friendly and welcoming. My hubby opted for fish and chips large and myself I got the king prawns. They were delicious!!! The fries in my opinion were mediocre. The batter for the fish and the prawns were great!!! A lot of food!! Neither of us finished our fries. Large portions. I ordered a milkshake - very rich and sweet! My hubby opted for a pale ale beer. He also ordered the mash peas which were not very good and not worth the price, hardly touched that. So next time you come just stick to the fish and chips!! They are awesome !! Opt for take out if you want to save money :)

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Pale ale & chocolate milkshake (4.95)
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Mushy peas (2)

xXpYbWaMsDkbPGVExGdkGg.text: Great place for a quick bite to eat. There was a line when we came but they moved things along quickly and we were seated within 15 minutes. The food is great and it was not to noisy. Definitely recommend this place for some great fish and chips.

dpyPopqizn8woIB8JmAcug.text: Good fish and  chips, nothing out of the normal.. is little price but this is what u get when around oxford st. What was amazingly good was the chips! They are to die for :)  The small portion is nicely served so there's really nothing to complain about this place. PS: the decoration is cute .

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Delicous chips!! Omg
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

u_SZO1S__i2dSpxByRprow.text: OK, I have to admit that I've only had fish and chips in the US before, and I've never been a big fan, but after eating here tonight, I am in LOVE! Definitely order the haddock, homemade tartare, and mushy peas!The hubs ordered the haddock and I ordered the cod. They were both amazing, but I liked the haddock slightly more than the cod since it was fluffier. We were going to order the small size for both, but when the server told us that you get about 2 ounces more fish for only £1 more, we both ordered the large size, in typical American fashion. The chips were addictive. They reminded me of In-N-Out fries from the US...they tasted freshly cut and were just crispy enough. All of the fish and the chips stayed crispy 'til the last bite!We also ordered the homemade tartare sauce. I would say the hubs and I dip a moderate amount of sauce and the small size was just perfect. The mushy peas were also a pleasant surprise! I normally don't like peas, but these peas were so good that they reminded me of one of my favorite Chinese desserts (mung bean soup), but in a savory form. Now off to find a good mushy pea recipe!

xD28IWeq0fWCOdEPuQad2g.text: The fish was good, the chips average and the strawberry milkshake fantastic! The restaurant is located just off Oxford street, and is definitely a good choice for meal in the midst of shopping. I will go again for sure!

qoEGd5PHFoJHVPnpnj_jdA.text: Friendly and quick service.The pies run out but the fish. OMG so good! if you are visiting in town but want to skip the smells of the local pub this is your stop for fish and chips!

RZo0gb3AOvXrEqvnfs_OHA.text: Came by here for a filling dinner before hitting the bar. I was seated quickly and opted for Haddock and Chips. The food was okay, but I've had much better. It was filling and not too expensive, so it fit the bill. I was expecting better quality. The small order was massive, so I'm glad I didn't opt for the large.

3b5sM8D9kXj8TLDqUSTpMQ.text: We had the cod and haddock fish and chips. Both were flaky and chunky, though like the menu says, the haddock is flakier and the cod chunkier. The haddock frying actually was not crispy all around, but rather, a little soggy. That was a little disappointing. Overall good quality fish, but I guess it's hit or miss on the frying quality.

85WaQz2goOAW2Suq56gRmQ.text: WOW. Fish and Chips in the UK really is way better than in the US. Definitely not cheaper but, definitely better tasting.We stopped in around 8:30pm at night and this place was still bustling so, that should tell you something. I had the small Cod and Chips and was pleasantly surprised when my plate came with a GIANT, deliciously battered, light and fresh fillet. The cod was nice and meaty and the batter was so incredibly light. I couldn't believe it. We're not talking a tiny piece of fish and inch thick batter--this was all fish, baby. I loved every bite and WISHED that California had anything even remotely like this. Chips weren't that good. The fries were a bit dry and could use some salt but, luckily they have plenty to ketchup and vinegar for me to dress them with.For me, Golden Union Fish Bar has been my most memorable meal in the UK thus far.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cod&Chips

KfGP9NRwpAI91mqzb6e69A.text: When we arrived in London, we got fish and chips to start our trip.  When we left London, we had our last meal here.  The cod fish and chips were excellent.  They were perfectly battered (not thick) and cooked to a golden crispy perfection.The tartar sauce was a good condiment for the fish.  I'm glad that I ate here as the last meal; otherwise, I might have eaten here a lot more and missed out with all the other great restaurants in the neighborhood.So if you are looking for the best chippy place in the area, you must eat here.

oyPPkRBuK7I2djzKnJjbHA.text: Decent fish and chips. Chips were better than the fish. Very light and flaky batter. However the gherkin pickle was the highlight of the meal.

b2t3gA4HmjeNPZZ3wCG7Ew.text: Legit. Went there while touring London. Clean, no-frill, diner-like atmosphere. Decent service. Reasonable prices and well-fried, crisp batter and moist fish. Had haddock and plaice, and both were delicious. Large was more than I could finish and cost me ~13 pounds. Really nothing to complain about.

YJGeLeYHlRNF-QFqh5zdlQ.text: YES. My first meal in London... had to get me some fish n chips. The small is enough for one hungry person, and the large is enough for two people. Drizzle the vinegar and squeeze that giant lemon on yo fish for the best results. You can also order tartar sauce separately. The most popular item is the cod, but many also opt for the haddock. The cod is more flaky and fatty, and haddock is more meaty in my opinion. Both are delicious and moist on the inside, just depends on your preference!

1ot-4CCRB8ZIFd1RCxyErw.text: Great and patient staff. That is already worth 5 stars!Batter was light and non greasy. The cod still had some shine to it, nicely cooked. Worth returning!

Kj9ITjsgirjxc6aI-wmIfA.text: This was supposed to be one of the best fish and chips place in town but i must say i am not a big fan of fish and chips so i thought it was just ok. The batter was well made, light and crispy. If you need something quick, this is a good option.

vb5Miu5dfRiCvs1RqoBdyg.text: Best fish and chips here!  Had the cod and chips. Crispy on the outside,  soft on the inside. Goes great with  the tartar sauce! Mushy peas were mediocre but I would definitely come back here! Prices are average. Cod and chips was 11 gbp. Service was great too.  Atmosphere is like a diner. Fits around 40-50 people. They also do take out. Overall, recommended to try when you're in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips with a bottle of Pumphouse pale ale

X8DDl_Nxv3enqOpeI70I4g.text: We came here to eat recently, for dinner, on July 2nd. We were here on vacation and it was only our 2nd day in London. We wanted a fish and chips dinner and had picked this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews. Halfway through our dinner I had my bag stolen and my 9yr old daughter was the one who witnessed it happening. I ran out the restaurant along with my husband, and our waiter to chase the guys down. I asked the manager if he could watch my kids. By the time I got back which wasn't even 30minutes, they had moved my kids to the bar eating area and completely cleared our table. We stayed until closing to file a police report. While doing so my kids were helping our waiter clean up which was fine because it kept them distracted while my husband and I talked to the police. While filing our police report the manager comes over to us to tell us that he had called the owner of the restaurant to tell him what happened to us and told us the owner said he felt horrible and told him not to charge us. The manager told him that he had already charged us and then he says "Sorry about that. What do you guys want me to do?" What do you expect us to say? Of course we were like "It's fine." However he saw first hand everything that happened to us, he saw my son crying cause he was scared we weren't going to come back for them, he had our table cleared when none of us were even done eating and he CHARGED US IN FULL. Like, is this a joke? Are you a human being? The fish was good, our waiter was great, the manager needs a heart. He even said to us "when I spoke to the owner he said that i shouldn't have even charged you before i called him." Like what is the point of you telling us this?! You are worse than the people who took my bag.

IqePsUxJY72F9nUvHJ33vQ.text: A really great place to get well cooked fish and chips in the heart of London Town. The restaurant has a very modern, fresh, clean vibe going on, with tiled floors and walls as well as neon signs and paintings of fishing boats. They cater for both those who want to take out or if you want to eat in.We did the latter. We ordered cod, chips, saveloy and mushy peas. Everything was hot, the chips were chunky and just greasy enough whilst the fish was coated in a golden crispy batter and inside lay the mouthwatering fish. The saveloy was full of the spicy sausage flavour, though seemed a little dried out. The mushy peas hadn't made an appearance three quarters of the way into the meal, so I asked for the order to be cancelled and they did apologies. There were the standard condiments on the table, salt, vinegar and sauce. Whilst all the food was great there was some element about it that made me feel it wasn't a wholly traditional fish and chip experience. Perhaps it was the lack of wrapping paper. The bathroom was pretty standard and an average amount of clean.I will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Fish, chips and saveloy!
Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom

Qc9WFxnDHGdTFdJC88lnJg.text: Super cool place. The staff is super friendly. The fish was amazing! The chips could be better, so that and that the Price is a little high makes it only 4 stars. But I can reccomend it for sure :)

NJqHCQP6PQ3fbzr0o3z8uQ.text: Was in London for the first time and knew that I had to try fish and chips! I found this place listed on top fish and chips spots in London so of course I had to come and check it out. The place was very clean and super sleek and modern inside. Great service and quick food. I would recommend ordering the normal size portion of fish and chips and not large. My husband eats a lot and he was perfectly satisfied with the normal size, the large looked huge from what I saw across other customer tables. I got the fish bites, which is basically fish and chip but you get cod and haddock fish in smaller bites. I would highly recommend this, it was a few pounds cheaper and exactly the same thing that my husband got (when he paid a bit more for the fish and chips). They do have a 12.5% optional service charge added, which I thought was a strange. It makes the situation awkward because you really don't want to pay the extra pounds, but it's weird asking them to remove it. This definitely gave me a bad taste in my mouth. I'm from America so I normally tip when I go to Europe when I get good service, so I thought it strange that they would sort of force it on you. The fish and chips was also very bland. This may be because I'm used to more seasoning. The crust itself was very flaky and good. Overall food was OK, but I'm sure others would enjoy it more if they are bigger fish and chip fans.

ZYINBOv2APErPsjxCE9YfQ.text: When they say "hole in the wall" restaurants are typically the best, golden union is the definition of that and then some. We had the cod, prawns, and sausage which were all really good. The portions were huge!! I dont remember what the larger fish portion is called but unless you plan to take it to go or share it, you don't need it. The prawns were huge as there was more shrimp than breading. As for the sausage I didn't even know you could fry a sausage but it was also huge.  This location is convenient as it is just off oxford street. If you are looking for authentic fish n chips this is the place to be.

p7WWh0SAsQ9k0p7VhiXKVA.text: Service was super slow. I guess in london you might as well try fish and chips atleast once. The cod chips were rather bland no real flavor. It wasnt bad but i wouldnt come back. Get the fish bites instead of the full fish its cheaper and taste better

x-hRZ5jmBzoKMTbZRhBeig.text: I'm not the biggest fish and chips fan (even when ate fish), so I appreciated the battered halloumi on offer here. The mushy peas were also quite tasty. Cool atmosphere, nice service. A bit on the pricey side, but not too bad.

3dOD7Nltp-W9CMBrAnOb1Q.text: Best Fish I've had over the years. The chips were okay, not bad, but the fish was superb. I've had everything from the local vendor serving soggy fish and chips in newsprint soaked in vinegar out of a van to upscale gourmet twists on the classic. This was the best fish of them hall. They several choices for the fish (Cod, Haddock,etc.), a good sign in itself. The oil must be light along with the batter so the fish really stands out.The location is tucked right off Oxford Street in the bustling area near Oxford Circus on a quieter [Poland] street. Clean feel inside, small comfortable sitting area with a free music jukebox to boot.Don't miss this for a great example of how the classic fish and chips dish should be served.

bcgSsDAN5PC8n1NwEElmDA.text: We loved this little joint. Great haddock; crisp, but not greasy, and not too thick a batter. Mushy peas delicious and not salty, which is rare in these parts of the London woods. The pickled egg was a waste of money. Blech. Service from our Russian, Polish, Lithuanian servers was nice. Convenient location. Go!

4x3HMY8XHSQlgTwSkuQqfA.text: This spot is clean, basic and manages to not feel or smell at all oily or greasy. Great fish that's obviously fresh, and chips that actually taste like potatoes. I don't think you can go wrong here, service is fast, food is consistently good. A good London stop for that iconic dish.

Fzj-kDHeTMj32mBpjUVEaw.text: If you are close by you have got to drop in and try them, the fish fillet used is fresh, had the cod and haddock, the batter used was tasty, won't have that layer of oil sticking to the mouth. Generous with chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Union Fish Bar - London, United Kingdom. Large cod and chips, and I wants having the bites and chips which made up of cods and haddocks.

t_6g3mQb3IkZ6kwSWdq8Aw.text: We set out from our hostel that morning looking for fish and chips and we definitely picked a good one. This shop specializes in fish and chips as is suggested by the name of the restaurant. They have a few different types of fish you can select from and options to choose a regular portion or a larger portion if you're more hungry. The fish itself was fried very well and the crispy outside wrapped the juicy fish interior. The tartar sauce paired perfectly well with the fried fish. The chips (french fries in the US) weren't spectacular, but with a little malt vinegar, they're pretty tasty too. This place specializes in Fish and Chips and they do it well.

H8OTDVZcE2IhLVBgtPbPHw.text: Pretty good. Descent fish & chips. Descent portions. The fries (chips) could be a little crispier but that's just personal preference. We also ordered the chicken and mushroom meat pie. It was pretty good! I'd come back again for a quick bite to eat whenever I'm visiting the area again.

8t-WP-anl4yoir-3TRjeaA.text: Located in Soho area, off Oxford street, easy to find a place even for tourists. Nice place to enjoy authentic fish and chips.

vrfhqezsjGN9QU2Xod8JZg.text: Fish and chips is a relatively popular dish in the US, and I thought I knew what a decent fish fry was. Then I came to the UK and I've been learning that us Yanks have a lot to learn about properly frying foods! I came here during the summer while backpacking through Europe.I ordered a large haddock and chips, Guinness, and mushy peas. The fish was fried beautifully, in a way that I've never seen fish fried before. It was so light and crispy that it reminded me of phyllo pastry on the outside, and the juicy and steaming fish in the center was perfect. The chips were equally perfectly fried, and the peas were so damn tasty.Service was friendly and offered me some suggestions, and the restaurant was vibrant with a lot of customers even mid-day. It was boiling hot inside the restaurant though, which can I guess be attributed to the heat wave this summer.I know that I need to explore the chippy scene in England more when I go back, but for what I got to try in London, this was the best fish & chips I've ever had in my life.

8vyws5Gp7pNhaqEAiG5Qgw.text: We both ordered the small cod and chips, and were pleasantly surprised with the size of our dish.  The fish was stellar, however the fried were not exactly my favorite.  The mushy peas was ok, and the tartar sauce (which was ordered separately) was awesome.
